reviewers: [{'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin Sbârnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll 🥕'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 360, 'date': '2019-02-01 14:32:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-02-01 16:33:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Isn't easier to make it work with python3?"}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-02-01 16:35:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This also indicates that we have no CI for the report itself which should be fixed in order to avoid future regressions.

It this is time consuming we can put a pattern to run the job only when some files are changes.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-02-01 16:49:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Revert the cireport to python2

The CI report has not yet been converted to python3 so we
need to temporarily revert it to python2.

Change-Id: I19e71390b384cec9f12a415e21f3689877a3f63d

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john@johngarbutt.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10343, 'name': 'Jim Rollenhagen', 'email': 'jim@jimrollenhagen.com', 'username': 'jimrollenhagen'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! messages:
[{'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-10-11 13:54:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-10-11 14:02:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

One clarification that is probably worth making noted inline. Otherwise this seems like what we discussed and is fairly straightforward.'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-10-11 14:54:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-10-11 18:35:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-10-15 14:26:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-10-15 14:46:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

This describes what we discussed at PTG.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-16 13:03:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

If this was the agreed method of doing things, then cool, this is a good and readable description.

But it seems rather a shame that we're using configuration files for dynamic coordination rather than a coordination API of some kind. Was there any discussion doing of using tooz or etcd?"}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-10-17 11:33:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I don't believe there was any discussion about adding a dependency on etcd and friends for this. I'm totally open to it.

That said, if we want to use something like etcd to do this, I think it makes more sense to just have an etcd backend for the servicegroup API. And so we still need to be able to stuff this data there. At which point we could just use the DB-backed servicegroup API, right?"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-17 18:47:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I'm really worried about how brittle this is especially if you can update a node's conductor_group in ironic - if that is possible, what do we expect to happen? Automatically trigger a migration of the server in nova from host A to host B?

The details in the alternatives section is also not really fleshed out in any meaningful way."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-10-19 14:01:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-10-19 14:42:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

So I'm confused. This is exactly what we agreed to at PTG as an imperfect but doable initial first implementation of this. We discussed etcd or new placement work, along with adding attributes to the compute or service record to do this (which would be either ironic-specific or a new generic metadata function). All of those things are extra dependencies, which have up and downsides, but we agreed that we could just do the config thing as a first step as none of those seemed to be obviously easy to accomplish in short order.

So, is the -1 just for adding flesh to the alternatives section or are we now retracting that decision?"}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-10-23 11:42:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-10-23 11:50:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-10-23 11:50:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-10-23 16:38:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-23 16:48:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

> So, is the -1 just for adding flesh to the alternatives section or are we now retracting that decision?

As noted inline, I wasn't paying attention to the discussion on this at the PTG, so I've raised questions which should have points fleshed out in the spec for those that weren't in the group talking about this in person (I don't think that's unreasonable to expect).

The stuff about updating the conductor group on a node concerns me, but it sounds like that's mostly a "meh, operators shouldn't do that, but it might magically work with the hash ring rebalance stuff".'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-23 16:52:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

I don't want to block this since obviously people involved talked about it in person and agree this is a satisfactory way forward, despite the config management involved which isn't awesome. I can't say, however, that I'm the best person to approve this given my lack of knowledge in this area of nova/ironic land. Maybe Jay needs to push this forward since he probably knows more about it than I do (and cares given Oath)."}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-10-24 11:26:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

(1 comment)

Thanks for the questions, Matt, they helped find a hole here. I'm heading out on vacation tomorrow so will need to come back to this next week."}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-11-02 17:36:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-11-02 17:43:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-11-02 19:45:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-11-09 17:39:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Still okay with this as discussed already. Obviously I agree that it's not optimal to need three config values, but as long as it has taken us to get this moved through, adding a new generic mechanism for storing this data seems likely to be further delaying."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-10 13:22:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Question inline about using a sentinel for partition_key rather than the new use_partition_key to enable/disable the feature. But +2 anyway since it's just a thought, we can move forward without it."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-11-12 17:48:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(4 comments)

I'm actually a little confused (a lot, really...) with this proposal. I'm not sure, based on the wording in it, how this proposal improves things over the existing hash-ring partitioning scheme that is currently in place. Jim, could you elaborate on that?

Thanks!

-jay"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-11-13 12:47:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

Again, we discussed this in Denver at the PTG and am disappointed we're still holding this up re-discussing the same things. I'd love it if we could move forward with this RSN.

Jay, any issues with me +Wing this now?"}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-11-13 15:56:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-11-13 16:12:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-14 08:38:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

(1 comment)

Sounds like there will be a couple of updates here, I'm good after that."}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-11-14 10:05:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-11-14 10:05:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-14 12:30:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Nit inline but looks OK to me now that I understand the problem.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-11-14 12:42:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-02-01 18:31:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}]

commit_message:
Use conductor groups to partition nova-compute services for Ironic

This spec proposes using ironic's conductor group feature to limit the
subset of nodes which a nova-compute service will manage. This allows
for partitioning nova-compute services to a particular location
(building, aisle, rack, etc), and provides a way for operators to manage
the failure domain of a given nova-compute service.

Change-Id: I62b838ee5fc56d97fdd35d620dd76d50606d0f34
Implements: blueprint ironic-conductor-groups

commit_message:
Add port forwarding floating IP QoS

Port forwarding floating IPs QoS should be limited under
the binding QoS policy. So this patch extends the l3-agent
fip-qos agent extension floating IP list with the port
forwarding related IPs.

Change-Id: Iddabfabafc0803edd1e4ac0893dc188f1907234a
Closes-Bug: #1796925

commit_message:
Migrate linting to pre-commit

Follows the same linting configuration that was implemented first in
tripleo-quickstart-extras which makes used of pre-commit tool for
managing all linters.

This also avoids problems where a new linter release may break our
gates because pre-commit always pins versions.

Removes ansible from requirements.txt as it needs to be listed only
in ansible-requirements.txt

(cherry picked from commit 8ac74a817704ca50674e6beaa91b792f62660942)
(cherry picked from commit 261732aa187a12adb696b975d7ac1c6e9c72a856)

Change-Id: Ie742132563be59b57e3c881f7dc81556c67d8849

commit_message:
Remove default post-save command from mysql

That was not being used. The new certificate will be picked up when
mysql is restarted (which would happen on an upgrade).

Change-Id: If4ca3e9f0c248ae6df6c57edc9a2adf841d2e425
Related-Bug: #1811401

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-20 21:38:05.000000000', 'message': "Remove redundant default chrony server config

While it is possible to specify both servers and pools in the same
config, and duplicate entries will be discarded, it's unnecessary to
specify both - especially if they contain the same value. Use of pool
is preferred to server, so remove default NtpServer value in favor of
a cleaner default chrony.conf.

Change-Id: I5498124f3ca1a691cd178be0d8517e6d5a8ae410
"}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant default chrony server config

While it is possible to specify both servers and pools in the same
config, and duplicate entries will be discarded, it's unnecessary to
specify both - especially if they contain the same value. Use of pool
is preferred to server, so remove default NtpServer value in favor of
a cleaner default chrony.conf.

Change-Id: I5498124f3ca1a691cd178be0d8517e6d5a8ae410

we make sure this is a noop when using pcs-0.9 which
does not support knet-clusters where passing an addr is
required.

commit_message:
Set pacemaker cluster_members_addr

We always set the cluster_members_addr parameter.
By adding a dep-on I27b8aa930a7413069539eb4fac13c41822049889
we make sure this is a noop when using pcs-0.9 which
does not support knet-clusters where passing an addr is
required.

Depends-On: I2e92bb2424f9d674ba888a8c287a26b69f7d9dff
Depends-On: I27b8aa930a7413069539eb4fac13c41822049889
Change-Id: I01d5625eb7fe75e539727daeeab20f2801964865

Update .gitignore

Ignore AUTHORS, ChangeLog and dist/* .
These files are autogenerated when creating a sdist tarbar (via eg.
"python setup.py sdist")

Change-Id: I90cf0d2067ac019e624b2daed78ce02673e5e4bd

[{'created': '2019-01-22 22:19:56.000000000', 'message': 'WIP noop package installation inside docker_puppet_apply.sh

Just as we noop package installation in docker-puppet.py when run
inside containers (via I2bd247af2b54f3a834cdc8a2f253600527c7acd8)
we should always noop them inside the docker_puppet_apply.sh helper
script as it is always run inside containers anyway.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I572e31e933f7fd5b1bb695f28f78d57dceb28994
Related-Bug: #1812923
'}, {'created': '2019-01-26 10:18:42.000000000', 'message': 'noop package installation inside docker_puppet_apply.sh

Just as we noop package installation in docker-puppet.py when run
inside containers (via I2bd247af2b54f3a834cdc8a2f253600527c7acd8)
we should always noop them inside the docker_puppet_apply.sh helper
script as it is always run inside containers anyway.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Related-Bug: #1812923
'}]
commit_message:
noop package installation inside docker_puppet_apply.sh

Just as we noop package installation in docker-puppet.py when run
inside containers (via I2bd247af2b54f3a834cdc8a2f253600527c7acd8)
we should always noop them inside the docker_puppet_apply.sh helper
script as it is always run inside containers anyway.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I572e31e933f7fd5b1bb695f28f78d57dceb28994
Related-Bug: #1812923

commit_message:
update install instructions for ubuntu 16.04

I haven't been able to get the existing install instructions to
work.

I believe ubuntu 16.04 is the most tested according to devstack[1]
so that's the reason for 16.04.

This commit aims to update the install to work for ubuntu 16.04
today.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/devstack/latest/#quick-start

Change-Id: Ia511e87edd95c510b36d4318fdd12020afbc38b5

commit_message:
Don't error on translation warnings

Disable treading warnings as errors for broken translations to be able
to work on the docs.

Change-Id: Ic7d9ae1d5ffaa00c16d890ef9759b706cac7d89c

subject: Set up DB schema in DevStack plugin using Alembic
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-01 15:30:27.000000000', 'message': "Set up DB schema in DevStack plugin using Alembic

SQL schema scripts are replaced with Alembic command line tool.
Notification plugins are enabled in notification engine configuration
file.

The change also fixes the initial schema vesion. The foreign key must
refer to the field with the same data type and collation. Otherwise the
schema migration fails occasionally with the IntegrityError[1]:

  oslo_db.exception.DBError: (pymysql.err.IntegrityError) (1215, 'Cannot add foreign key constraint')

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/61/622361/8/gate/monasca-tempest-python3-influxdb/26104a3/controller/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2019-01-30_15_52_45_455

Change-Id: I95d7e91e62ff13e84f963fdbb3bca6b7dfd7c310
Story: 2001654
Task: 14421

Fix initial Alembic schema

Change-Id: I07f5d2c8b5fb452710fc251193007491942d8794
"}]
commit_message:
Set up DB schema in DevStack plugin using Alembic

SQL schema scripts are replaced with Alembic command line tool.
Notification plugins are enabled in notification engine configuration
file.

The change also fixes the initial schema vesion. The foreign key must
refer to the field with the same data type and collation. Otherwise the
schema migration fails occasionally with the IntegrityError[1]:

  oslo_db.exception.DBError: (pymysql.err.IntegrityError) (1215, 'Cannot add foreign key constraint')

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/61/622361/8/gate/monasca-tempest-python3-influxdb/26104a3/controller/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2019-01-30_15_52_45_455

Change-Id: I95d7e91e62ff13e84f963fdbb3bca6b7dfd7c310
Story: 2001654
Task: 14421

Fix initial Alembic schema

Change-Id: I07f5d2c8b5fb452710fc251193007491942d8794

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-31 20:38:13.000000000', 'message': "Update network-policy ldap deployment and test

This updates the script for deploying ldap in the network policy
job to accept ingress traffic from prometheus pods.

This also updates the network policy test to account for return
values with more than one result when checking for a pod to use,
as well as selecting pods by application and component labels
instead of simply grepping for a name (as this could cause issues
with grepping for 'fluentd', when that could return both fluentd
and fluentd-exporter pods, for example)

Change-Id: I12a4029f574ea7d5b250709adef21b07d8cf0220
"}, {'created': '2019-01-31 21:29:40.000000000', 'message': "Update network-policy ldap deployment and test

This updates the script for deploying ldap in the network policy
job to accept ingress traffic from prometheus pods.

This also updates the network policy test to account for return
values with more than one result when checking for a pod to use,
as well as selecting pods by application and component labels
instead of simply grepping for a name (as this could cause issues
with grepping for 'fluentd', when that could return both fluentd
and fluentd-exporter pods, for example)

Change-Id: I12a4029f574ea7d5b250709adef21b07d8cf0220
"}]
commit_message:
Update network-policy ldap deployment and test

This updates the script for deploying ldap in the network policy
job to accept ingress traffic from prometheus pods.

This also updates the network policy test to account for return
values with more than one result when checking for a pod to use,
as well as selecting pods by application and component labels
instead of simply grepping for a name (as this could cause issues
with grepping for 'fluentd', when that could return both fluentd
and fluentd-exporter pods, for example)

Change-Id: I12a4029f574ea7d5b250709adef21b07d8cf0220

commit_message:
Secure dnsmasq process against external abuse

Currently any dhcp agent instance will work as an open resolver. For
deployments using publicly routed addresses for tenant networks, this
allows the agent being abused in dDoS attacks, see [1].

By setting the `--local-service` option dnsmasq will filter DNS queries
and reply only to queries from directly attached networks.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1501206

Conflicts:
    neutron/cmd/sanity_check.py

Closes-Bug: 1501206
Change-Id: I76d810aad2ce0f15a88bd798963012fa0efca74e
(cherry picked from commit 0fce3ca2c1641fbcfb8327a86d7225e2c3972263)

commit_message:
remove unused methods in common_db_mixin

The following methods are no longer used in CommonDbMixin:
- register_dict_extend_funcs
- _apply_filters_to_query
- _filter_non_model_columns

This patch removes them from neutron.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Ic7042cdcb29e95cc3a13292819d77abc3971fe8a

subject: WIP libvirt: Avoid premature calls to disconnect_volume during LM
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9555, 'name': 'Matthew Booth', 'email': 'mbooth@redhat.com', 'username': 'MatthewBooth'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-02-01 12:07:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-02-01 12:14:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

WIP as I'm not sure if this needs additional func tests and/or additional coverage in the LM or multiattach jobs."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-02-01 12:18:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2019-02-01 13:02:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2019-02-01 13:20:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't think this works. I don't think it's an issue with your modification specifically, just that the code it's based on is fundamentally flawed at the design level. For example, your modification is going to fail in the case when all attached volumes on a single host are live migrating concurrently. Given the existence of host-evacuate-live, this isn't even an unlikely occurence. Another case is multiple resizes or cold migrations.

I know we're looking for something backportable here, but the current implementation is so broken I don't see a small fix which doesn't just make matters even more complicated.

I think we need to reference count attachments on the host under a lock. If we do this, we will always know when we're detaching the last one. This change would be larger, but still potentially backportable as it would be local to a single compute with no RPC or API implications."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-02-01 13:48:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-02-01 13:55:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-02-01 15:02:33.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

As discussed this is wrong as instance.host isn't updated until later in the flow.

The actual issue is that the connection_info we have has just been pulled directly from Cinder API and doesn't include the multiattach key that Nova adds during the attach process:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5a4863aa152f58f6de426b3908a75c2cc1b2efca/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L7970-L7976

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5a4863aa152f58f6de426b3908a75c2cc1b2efca/nova/virt/block_device.py#L538-L549

Matt already has https://review.openstack.org/#/c/551302/ open that should correct this given it uses the existing connection_info for the volume that contains the multiattach key."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-01 12:07:15.000000000', 'message': "WIP libvirt: Avoid premature calls to disconnect_volume during LM

Idc5cecffa9129d600c36e332c97f01f1e5ff1f9f introduced basic checks to
ensure that disconnect_volume is only called against a multi-attach
volume when a single instance, assumed to be the instance we are
detaching the volume from, remains attached to the volume on the host.

The change however didn't take live migration into account and more
specifically the call to disconnect_volume during post_live_migration at
the end of the migration from the source. At this point the original
instance has already moved, as a result the call to get_uuids_by_host
will only return any remaining instances that are attached to the volume
on the host.

This in turn allows disconnect_volume to be called prematurely if a single
instance remains on the host attached to the volume as it is assumed
this is the instance we are detaching the volume from.

This change adds an additional check to _should_disconnect_target so
that no attempt is made to call disconnect_volume when a single
connection remains and the provided instance is no longer present on the
host, as is the case during post_live_migration.

Closes-Bug: #1814245
Change-Id: I6cac94e29c499fdb5ae8bdcfcd831174c0dcc10a
"}]
commit_message:
WIP libvirt: Avoid premature calls to disconnect_volume during LM

Idc5cecffa9129d600c36e332c97f01f1e5ff1f9f introduced basic checks to
ensure that disconnect_volume is only called against a multi-attach
volume when a single instance, assumed to be the instance we are
detaching the volume from, remains attached to the volume on the host.

The change however didn't take live migration into account and more
specifically the call to disconnect_volume during post_live_migration at
the end of the migration from the source. At this point the original
instance has already moved, as a result the call to get_uuids_by_host
will only return any remaining instances that are attached to the volume
on the host.

This in turn allows disconnect_volume to be called prematurely if a single
instance remains on the host attached to the volume as it is assumed
this is the instance we are detaching the volume from.

This change adds an additional check to _should_disconnect_target so
that no attempt is made to call disconnect_volume when a single
connection remains and the provided instance is no longer present on the
host, as is the case during post_live_migration.

Closes-Bug: #1814245
Change-Id: I6cac94e29c499fdb5ae8bdcfcd831174c0dcc10a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-16 09:02:48.000000000', 'message': "Add method to generate device names universally

When attaching block devices, we find the next device name to use by
looking at the used device letters in the block device mappings and
selecting the next available letter, as long as the letter is within
'a' - 'z' or 'aa' - 'zz'. This allows us to represent 702 devices (and
would interestingly hit an IndexError if all 'a' - 'z' and 'aa' - 'zz'
letters were in use already.

This adds a method for generating device names universally, not limited
to any particular maximum, based on a device index. For example:

  vda(index=0), sdb(index=1), vdaa(index=26), sdabc(index=730), ...

This method and its helper method will be used in a subsequent patch.

Part of blueprint conf-max-attach-volumes

Change-Id: I2699f600a98222a4dc58903ec97ca70e57701c93
(cherry picked from commit 36f310f469b91c7de72a8366c7d493e1e7a4fd0f)
"}]
commit_message:
Add method to generate device names universally

When attaching block devices, we find the next device name to use by
looking at the used device letters in the block device mappings and
selecting the next available letter, as long as the letter is within
'a' - 'z' or 'aa' - 'zz'. This allows us to represent 702 devices (and
would interestingly hit an IndexError if all 'a' - 'z' and 'aa' - 'zz'
letters were in use already.

This adds a method for generating device names universally, not limited
to any particular maximum, based on a device index. For example:

  vda(index=0), sdb(index=1), vdaa(index=26), sdabc(index=730), ...

This method and its helper method will be used in a subsequent patch.

Part of blueprint conf-max-attach-volumes

Change-Id: I2699f600a98222a4dc58903ec97ca70e57701c93
(cherry picked from commit 36f310f469b91c7de72a8366c7d493e1e7a4fd0f)

In Python 3 dict.values() returns a dictionary view object
which don't support indexing.
Because of that some tests in

commit_message:
Convert result of hosts.values() to list always

In Python 3 dict.values() returns a dictionary view object
which don't support indexing.
Because of that some tests in
tempest.api.compute.admin.test_servers_on_multinodes module
were failing when running on python 3.

This patch fixes this issue by converting result of dict.values()
method to list always.

Change-Id: I5580dd7a6f22fbe880ea81b3e36b3d6111209958

commit_message:
Add mutex class

This will expose Windows mutexes. We usually rely on file locks
when synchronizing multiple processes, mostly for portability
reasons.

Some times, file locks may not be an option, in which case a
named mutex can be useful. We intend to use this in Glance when
ensuring that only one scrubber can run at a time.

Change-Id: I4a2a51e2164c6f5816f2af2641d41d1db7870600

commit_message:
Update cloud-archive.list when upgrading from Pike to Queens

ceph-mon charm only upgrades when the ceph version changes, for the
case of upgrading from Pike to Queens the charm is skipping any
upgrades, because the Cloud Archive has Luminous for those 2 releases.

This patch checks if the requested ceph version is luminous and if the
'source' changed from pike to queens to then upgrade
/etc/apt/sources.list.d/cloud-archive.list via add_source()

Change-Id: I05b7d722e45d3a02a97866903a67bd9b16d4f552
Closes-Bug: 1778823

commit_message:
TLS everywhere: Set post-save command for redis

The default command wasn't working, here we set one that will actually work.

The script additionally copies the certificates in the right place
and instead of restarting stunnel, triggers a configuration reload.

Related-Bug: #1811401
Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Depends-On: I437d69fef45d1662e8908c5ca0f7063be6cb9b32
Change-Id: I49811a6cab5416d965ce1da93a71728ad5b1d27c

commit_message:
redis: Remove default post-save command for certmonger

The default command didn't work, so we need to fix that.

The script additionally copies the certificates in the right place
and instead of restarting stunnel, triggers a configuration reload.

Related-Bug: #1811401
Needed-By: I49811a6cab5416d965ce1da93a71728ad5b1d27c
Change-Id: I437d69fef45d1662e8908c5ca0f7063be6cb9b32

commit_message:
Don't exclude python bytecode files in dashboards

If these files are excluded from the rpm install then modified bytecode
files will remamin on disk on uninstall and cause unexpected behavior in
horizon. Remove these from the exclude list.

Change-Id: Ib03f38285c3de377d4c71de4ed7feb1bfa919a35

commit_message:
Support implied rules

Using keystone API[0] to get all role inference rules and makes it
possible to extend the used list of roles with implied roles.

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/#list-all-role-inference-rules
Change-Id: Ia57351f3b21a82f4556ec61323abd295b427fc1e

commit_message:
Pin rabbitmq-server to 3.7.10

New version of rabbitmq-server in epel but not new enough version of
erlang available in epel or delorean-trunk repos.

Closes-Bug: #1814233
Change-Id: Iac3cad17ff8279a2be66ffe1366d6844f999d66f

commit_message:
Modify Member tests for Provider Drivers

There is a possibility that the provider drivers may not support some
functionality. Member API tests are very closely coupled with Monitors,
so in case if a provider driver doesnt support monitors, the Octavia
API tests may not give the correct response. The following patch
attempts to split the same.

Change-Id: Idc0965550a57d4424a7d4f27525bf345324bd68a

commit_message:
Enable dbus-broker for Fedora 29

As described in the comments, it seems the transition between
dbus-daemon -> dbus-broker in Fedora 29 has made it so the packages
can get into a state where neither service is enabled.

Explicitly install and enable dbus-broker for F29

Change-Id: I06753043a75be2f635653899c6c251b9fbdd7c67

HTTP(S) proxy can be specified when creating the template.

However, it is not being utilized when talking to a public etcd discovery
service, which result in failed cluster creation. We need to be able to
use HTTP(S) proxy when services are running behind a firewall.

commit_message:
support http/https proxy for discovery url

HTTP(S) proxy can be specified when creating the template.

https://docs.openstack.org/magnum/latest/admin/magnum-proxy.html

However, it is not being utilized when talking to a public etcd discovery
service, which result in failed cluster creation. We need to be able to
use HTTP(S) proxy when services are running behind a firewall.

NOTE: this patch also updated some test cases to explicitly set
the proper HTTP status code in the mock HTTP request as by default
they are not be initialized, which caused those tests to fail.

Change-Id: I13d86b0dc7c232a51149107f0412219388d8c2cd
story: 2004664
(cherry picked from commit ffc61816c8cf7d6d3f1129b0d520a661b3b8cddf)
(cherry picked from commit f86de684d2dcca018d056c44be4e4b164b8a4b32)

commit_message:
Add lock_path in installation guide

Oslo_concurrency needs lock_path option, make it consistent in
documentation for Suse, Redhat and Ubuntu installation guides.

Change-Id: Ib675d7bf399f2aa7eba9d343fa0f06281d33089a
Related-Bug: #1796976
Closes-Bug: #1812497
(cherry picked from commit 534e85039271d91647173527cd4c4905b9532537)

I've rebased this on top of a patch I proposed to skip the test until it's fixed."}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2019-01-28 19:32:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I understand if we want to merge to master the skip patch independently of this to fix the gate as soon as possible. However how will we learn if this proposed fix is working if it's on top of the skip patch? Then test_subnet_details() will never run, not even for the jobs started by the patch sets of this change, will it?

Since this bug looks sensitive to timing, I really would like to see the proposed fix running in the gate environment (while I'm completely okay with it being skipped on master). The load and timings of my local machine could be completely different.

Am I missing something?"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-28 19:52:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> However how will we learn if this proposed fix is working if it's on top of the skip patch? Then test_subnet_details() will never run, not even for the jobs started by the patch sets of this change, will it?

I modified your change to remove the skip so it does run the test."}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2019-01-28 20:14:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm cool with this, thanks for investigating and proposing a fix Bence."}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-01-29 14:46:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-01-29 15:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Why not remove the dependency of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633566/ since it is not merged yet?

And https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633566/ should be abandoned.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-29 15:11:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Why not remove the dependency of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633566/ since it is not merged yet?

Because no tempest cores have even looked at this change yet so we don't know when it's going to merge, and we are unable to merge code because of the test failures so until a fix is merged we need to skip to actually make progress on merging code in openstack."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-29 21:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-01-29 22:17:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2019-01-30 09:01:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

recheck so far 6 passed out of 6 runs, this will be the 7th

I was trying to extract records of the success rate of this particular test from the gate without much success. All I could find was the success rate of the tempest-slow job which must be the same or worse as the success rate of the particular test. However for a good estimate on the effect of this change I need information from the other side (not succeeds at most but succeeds at least). Which I don't have.

Anyway if I ignore the difference between the job's and the test's success rate then in the last 2 weeks we had a success rate of 52/(22+52) ~= 70%. Given that the 6 passes out 6 runs we had so far could have happened with the chance of 70%**6 = 12% even if this change had no effect. Therefore I think I'm running a few more rechecks. If we have 10 passes out of 10 runs then the chance will go down to 3% - that is 97% chance of this change doing something."}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2019-01-30 12:03:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck so far 7 passed out of 7 runs, this will be the 8th'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2019-01-30 15:41:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2019-01-31 12:07:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2019-02-01 08:47:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

I am not super happy about this kind of changes, but there is no reasonable, better alternative.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-02-01 09:18:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

lgtm, we will have unstable_test decorator soon which can check the test stability. unskiped test passing here is enough for now.

thanks'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-28 13:43:01.000000000', 'message': "Raise renew_delay in TestNetworkBasicOps:test_subnet_details

Bug #1813198 can be reproduced both in cirros 0.3.5 and 0.4.0 by:

while true
do
    sudo /bin/kill -USR1 $( cat /var/run/udhcpc.$( ip -o addr | awk '/100.109.0.37/ {print $2}' ).pid )
    #sleep .1
done

Where 100.109.0.37 is the original IP of eth0 in cirros and the 'kill'
line basically reproduces how test_subnet_details() renews the dhcp
lease using busybox's udhcpc.

However if you uncomment the very short sleep in that loop, the error
is gone. It seems to me this because the following line in udhcpc:

https://git.busybox.net/busybox/tree/networking/udhcp/dhcpc.c?h=1_23_stable#n1093

Note: CirrOS 0.4.0 uses BusyBox v1.23.2.

That is SIGUSR1 triggers a renew request in udhcpc. Internally udhcpc
goes into RENEW_REQUESTED state. If it receives a 2nd SIGUSR1 signal
while still in that state then it deconfigures the interface briefly
before acquiring a new (many times still the same) address. For us it
means we should not retry renewing the lease too fast, because if we do
the address may get deconfigured leading to bug #1813198.

Note: the call of the deconfig script can be easily confirmed by
modifying it (for example to log something). In cirros it is located
under '/sbin/cirros-dhcpc'. Look for the case handling the 'deconfig'
parameter.

This patch increases the delay in retries.

Change-Id: I9b18ef2d835e02be30b7c557e5c10585722111a0
Closes-Bug: #1813198

commit_message:
Raise renew_delay in TestNetworkBasicOps:test_subnet_details

Bug #1813198 can be reproduced both in cirros 0.3.5 and 0.4.0 by:

while true
do
    sudo /bin/kill -USR1 $( cat /var/run/udhcpc.$( ip -o addr | awk '/100.109.0.37/ {print $2}' ).pid )
    #sleep .1
done

Where 100.109.0.37 is the original IP of eth0 in cirros and the 'kill'
line basically reproduces how test_subnet_details() renews the dhcp
lease using busybox's udhcpc.

However if you uncomment the very short sleep in that loop, the error
is gone. It seems to me this because the following line in udhcpc:

https://git.busybox.net/busybox/tree/networking/udhcp/dhcpc.c?h=1_23_stable#n1093

Note: CirrOS 0.4.0 uses BusyBox v1.23.2.

That is SIGUSR1 triggers a renew request in udhcpc. Internally udhcpc
goes into RENEW_REQUESTED state. If it receives a 2nd SIGUSR1 signal
while still in that state then it deconfigures the interface briefly
before acquiring a new (many times still the same) address. For us it
means we should not retry renewing the lease too fast, because if we do
the address may get deconfigured leading to bug #1813198.

Note: the call of the deconfig script can be easily confirmed by
modifying it (for example to log something). In cirros it is located
under '/sbin/cirros-dhcpc'. Look for the case handling the 'deconfig'
parameter.

This patch increases the delay in retries.

Change-Id: I9b18ef2d835e02be30b7c557e5c10585722111a0
Closes-Bug: #1813198

[{'created': '2019-01-31 21:12:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix test for 'force_persistent_boot_device' (i)PXE driver_info option

The string used for the 'force_persistent_boot_device' field in the
node's driver_info is split by an additional blank and hence doesn't
set the option to be tested. In addition, the test condition tests a
mostly independent call (which also explains why the test succeeds
despite thet option).

This patch removes the incorrect test and introduces new ones to
test the signature of prepare_ramdisk() which is the function in
which 'force_persistent_boot_device' is actually used.

Change-Id: I0b6a298837306fb8c6a46c13612b003dc62a7850

commit_message:
Fix test for 'force_persistent_boot_device' (i)PXE driver_info option

The string used for the 'force_persistent_boot_device' field in the
node's driver_info is split by an additional blank and hence doesn't
set the option to be tested. In addition, the test condition tests a
mostly independent call (which also explains why the test succeeds
despite the incorrect option).

This patch removes the incorrect test and introduces new ones to
test the signature of prepare_ramdisk() which is the function in
which 'force_persistent_boot_device' is actually used.

Change-Id: I0b6a298837306fb8c6a46c13612b003dc62a7850

commit_message:
Add node disks validation

Adds a validation to check node disks for root device hints and make
sure they have a sufficient size for the available flavors.

Closes-Bug: #1668972

Change-Id: I46c5b69601d37d2faa77d9da4bd1b3ff3373c086

back to the client with the log path in order to make
the debuging easy.

commit_message:
Move CI docs from contributor guide into new CI guide

Creates a new CI guide in the index and moves all the ci docs
from under the contributor index where they currently live.  This makes
it easier to find CI related docs and also makes the contributor guide
index significantly shorter and so again easier to navigate for newcomer

Change-Id: I8a2c6df43e23bed7572cc81929d0086335f6eb7a
Related-Bug: #1804642

subject: Default Ironic node properties are bogus
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-31 15:01:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2019-02-01 10:03:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-31 15:01:09.000000000', 'message': "Default Ironic node properties are bogus

Unless you add a 'properties' field under the 'ironic_config' for a node spec,
ironic nodes are registered with silly default properties (originating in the
os_ironic module) which cause validation to fail:

cpus:1, memory_mb: 1, local_gb: 1

We have enough info to add sensible defaults based on the VM configuration, so
let's do that.

Change-Id: I43fbe726d1d787d96be811f3ecd4234ea3b6bac3
Story: 2004908
Task: 29258
"}]
commit_message:
Default Ironic node properties are bogus

Unless you add a 'properties' field under the 'ironic_config' for a node spec,
ironic nodes are registered with silly default properties (originating in the
os_ironic module) which cause validation to fail:

cpus:1, memory_mb: 1, local_gb: 1

We have enough info to add sensible defaults based on the VM configuration, so
let's do that.

Change-Id: I43fbe726d1d787d96be811f3ecd4234ea3b6bac3
Story: 2004908
Task: 29258

subject: Use node state rather than 'cmd'
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-31 15:01:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2019-02-01 10:01:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-31 15:01:09.000000000', 'message': "Use node state rather than 'cmd'

There are two cases when we may want to delete things:

1. if a desired node configuration or spec changes, we delete existing node
   resources.
2. if we use the teardown.yml playbook, cmd == teardown, delete
   everything, including global state.

In both cases, Tenks state (state.yml), all nodes to be deleted are given a
'state' of absent'. We should therefore use this rather than the 'cmd' variable
which only works in the latter case.

Change-Id: Icc033340c7fd882e61d90e3d086f7ba4a5b673bf
Story: 2004907
Task: 29257
"}]
commit_message:
Use node state rather than 'cmd'

There are two cases when we may want to delete things:

1. if a desired node configuration or spec changes, we delete existing node
   resources.
2. if we use the teardown.yml playbook, cmd == teardown, delete
   everything, including global state.

In both cases, Tenks state (state.yml), all nodes to be deleted are given a
'state' of absent'. We should therefore use this rather than the 'cmd' variable
which only works in the latter case.

Change-Id: Icc033340c7fd882e61d90e3d086f7ba4a5b673bf
Story: 2004907
Task: 29257

subject: Configure VM interfaces in macvtap passthrough mode
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-31 15:01:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2019-02-01 10:11:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-31 15:01:09.000000000', 'message': "Configure VM interfaces in macvtap passthrough mode

Tenks currently uses macvtap interfaces in 'VEPA' mode for the VMs. If the VMs
run any virtual networking internally, typically this will use a different MAC
address, which will not be reachable from outside due to the macvtap MAC
filtering.

This change uses macvtap 'passthrough' mode, such that all traffic is passed.

Change-Id: I0077c7001b2b419a94ea420833fa6dd3e8a3a967
Story: 2004906
Task: 29256
"}]
commit_message:
Configure VM interfaces in macvtap passthrough mode

Tenks currently uses macvtap interfaces in 'VEPA' mode for the VMs. If the VMs
run any virtual networking internally, typically this will use a different MAC
address, which will not be reachable from outside due to the macvtap MAC
filtering.

This change uses macvtap 'passthrough' mode, such that all traffic is passed.

Change-Id: I0077c7001b2b419a94ea420833fa6dd3e8a3a967
Story: 2004906
Task: 29256

"}, {'created': '2019-01-31 10:26:58.000000000', 'message': "Allow setting node and volume name prefixes per-spec

Adds support for setting node and volume name prefixes on a per-spec
basis.  This allows for different node specifications to use different
names, e.g.  'controller' vs 'compute'.

This change also fixes an issue where node names were not globally unique, only
unique on a given hypervisor. This could cause issues if used with multiple
hypervisors.

This has been done by rewriting the scheduling logic, replacing the 'node
index' concept with a more concrete reservation of IPMI ports (which are
allocated per hypervisor), and decoupling this from generation of node names
(which are allocated globally).

Change-Id: I929b18918c2886f42c4d05b37c81f3e63c69a92f
Story: 2004894

hypervisors.

This has been done by rewriting the scheduling logic, replacing the 'node
index' concept with a more concrete reservation of IPMI ports (which are

(which are allocated globally).

commit_message:
Allow setting node and volume name prefixes per-spec

Adds support for setting node and volume name prefixes on a per-spec
basis.  This allows for different node specifications to use different
names, e.g.  'controller' vs 'compute'.

This change also fixes an issue where node names were not globally unique, only
unique on a given hypervisor. This could cause issues if used with multiple
hypervisors.

This has been done by rewriting the scheduling logic, replacing the 'node
index' concept with a more concrete reservation of IPMI ports (which are
allocated per hypervisor), and decoupling this from generation of node names
(which are allocated globally).

Change-Id: I929b18918c2886f42c4d05b37c81f3e63c69a92f
Story: 2004894
Task: 29201
Story: 31d2681
Task: 29248

commit_message:
[k8s-fedora-atomic] Update k8s default version

And also update the default value of keystone_auth_enabled from False
to True in favor of prompting the integration of OpenStack and K8s.

Tempest's service_availability config option includes all the service
availability which is further used by tests to take decision of skip
or run the test.

For example, [service_availability].heat is true then, heat test will run
or if [service_availability].heat is false then, all the heat related tests either
in heat tempest plugin or any other plugins will be skipped.

which is being removed by - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619973/

For better maintenance, we are moving all tempest non-owned service setting
to service devstack plugin side.

This commit add the setting of heat service on ceilometer devstack plugin.

commit_message:
Set Tempest's service_availability setting for Heat

Tempest's service_availability config option includes all the service
availability which is further used by tests to take decision of skip
or run the test.

For example, [service_availability].heat is true then, heat test will run
or if [service_availability].heat is false then, all the heat related tests either
in heat tempest plugin or any other plugins will be skipped.

Currently this setting for heat service[1] is in devstack lib/tempest
which is being removed by - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619973/

For better maintenance, we are moving all tempest non-owned service setting
to service devstack plugin side.

This commit add the setting of heat service on ceilometer devstack plugin.

Related-Bug: #1743688
[1] https://github.com/openstack/heat-tempest-plugin/blob/d6b253502af379cce420723fd5ab997bbf6487b5/heat_tempest_plugin/config.py#L15

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619990/
Change-Id: I5013ce8be1a4fb5219ea89a63add812558191025
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619973/

commit_message:
Use venv path for rdopkg call

The virtualenv where rdopkg is installed (as part of the DLRN setup)
is never activated, and binaries inside it are called with the whole
path. We need to do the same for rdopkg.

Change-Id: I8701133077f6e2713388ff7eafbc8faf5a18775c

commit_message:
Add "server_group" to instance_network_interface resource type

When instance_network_interface resource type only support get
metric on one instance with 'instance_id'. It can not work fine
with autoscaling with Heat.

This patch add "server_group" to get metric from servers with
the same defined metadata.

Change-Id: If544ae40537221b5584eb230f29c847c38032885

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-31 21:36:10.000000000', 'message': "s3api: fix up flakey LastModified assertions

I know I've seen test_obj.py:TestS3ApiObj.test_object_PUT_copy_metadata_copy
fail in the gate on occassion; testing locally, I saw it fail twice out
of 5,000 attempts, but I suspect the prevalence is higher in the more
resource-constrained gate.

With this change, I saw no failures through 15,000 attempts.

Change-Id: I7c3cd4fecf5c8db355cc07f18a07d27962309b9b
"}]
commit_message:
s3api: fix up flakey LastModified assertions

I know I've seen test_obj.py:TestS3ApiObj.test_object_PUT_copy_metadata_copy
fail in the gate on occassion; testing locally, I saw it fail twice out
of 5,000 attempts, but I suspect the prevalence is higher in the more
resource-constrained gate.

With this change, I saw no failures through 15,000 attempts.

Change-Id: I7c3cd4fecf5c8db355cc07f18a07d27962309b9b

commit_message:
Add node_operation to lock and conflict bypass

This patch adds node_operation to lock & conflict bypass. This
allows the node operation to be accepted even when a cluster is
locked.

This fixes an issue when a cluster stop_on_delete flag is set.

Change-Id: Ic92eda3964c0a90aac165b412243f62c2933e459

commit_message:
Add support for native TLS encryption on NBD for disk migration

The NBD protocol previously runs in clear text, offering no security
protection for the data transferred, unless it is tunnelled over some
external transport like SSH. Such tunnelling is inefficient and
inconvenient to manage. Support for TLS to the NBD clients & servers
provided by QEMU was added. In tls-everywhere use case we want to
take advantage of this feature to create the certificates and configure
qemu to use nbd tls.

Closes-Bug: 1793093
Depends-On: Ifa5cf08d5104a62c9c094e3585de33e19e265110
Depends-On: I1db1b60be4907511f0ec0f5aa0f0a45e1c5d9b45
Depends-On: I347881cf4822583179c0c042c42fa1e33dbcedd2
Change-Id: I7d9df304d75bdbe36ecdfe50e5ce6b42a53063cc

commit_message:
Update v3 identity domain configuration tests to work w/ pre-prov

I don't see any limitations by using pre-provisioned
credentials for these tests:

* test_show_default_group_config_and_options
* test_create_domain_config_and_show_config_groups_and_options
* test_create_update_and_delete_domain_config
* test_create_update_and_delete_domain_config_groups_and_opts

Change-Id: I8da97d5998fa50ffce305670cfbac6af74472690

When creating a test server and the volume fails to build
a VolumeResourceBuildErrorException is raised causing a resource

to the calling test so that the system is properly cleaned up of

commit_message:
Ensure volume is deleted after build error

When creating a test server and the volume fails to build
a VolumeResourceBuildErrorException is raised causing a resource
leak on the testing system[1]

This change aims to remove the volume before raising the exception
to the calling test so that the system is properly cleaned up of
testing resources before exiting.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/743062/

Change-Id: Ib064e4f2cb113f98da73db519d855fa892515f66

subject: Remove warnings.simplefilter to suppress ResourceWarning
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 12033, 'name': 'DellEMC XtremIO CI', 'email': 'emc.xio.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-xio-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 19307, 'name': 'Antonio Ojea', 'email': 'antonio.ojea.garcia@gmail.com', 'username': 'itsuugo'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23186, 'name': 'Felipe Monteiro', 'email': 'felipe.carneiro.monteiro@gmail.com', 'username': 'felipe.monteiro'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2019-01-29 11:52:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2019-01-30 05:09:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I grepped some logs for checking.

Without this patch: (logs from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633689/ )

 $ grep -c -H "ResourceWarning" *
 openstack-tox-py27.log:0
 openstack-tox-py36.log:20
 tempest-full.log:0
 tempest-full-py3.log:138

With this patch:

 $ grep -c -H "ResourceWarning" *
 openstack-tox-py27.log:0
 openstack-tox-py36.log:0
 tempest-full.log:0
 tempest-full-py3.log:0'}, {'account_id': 19307, 'date': '2019-01-30 07:43:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Looking at your test results, shouldn't be the number of matches = 1 with the patch applied?"}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2019-01-30 08:18:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Looking at your test results, shouldn't be the number of matches =
 > 1 with the patch applied?

yeah, good point. I should mention about it in the commit message. Well, I think using `warnings.simplefilter` causes a side-effect - ResourceWarning: unclosed file, socket, etc. in this case. And it happens only in python3 not in python2 environment.

And, I'm actually not sure the details of mechanism for these warnings. It's a bit complicated for me. But this should be the cause. (I guess warnings.simplefilter opens some file descriptors??)

So, with this patch, "ResourceWarning" warning which is not intended should be disappeared. So, I think the number of matches = 0 is fine with the patch in this case.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2019-01-30 23:46:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-02-01 07:07:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Change-Id: I9e96cfc062bbdaf73f8a4efb9af9dc581c96994f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove warnings.simplefilter to suppress ResourceWarning

This commit removes warnings.simplefilter from
tempest.lib.services.clients code to suppress annoying ResourceWarning
like following.

 ResourceWarning: unclosed file <_io.FileIO....

Change-Id: I9e96cfc062bbdaf73f8a4efb9af9dc581c96994f

commit_message:
Add PyJWT as a requirement

A subsequent patch will be using this library to create JWS tokens.
Here, we are requiring a minimum version of 1.6.1 since that version
includes an exception exposed from PyJWT that we need in keystone:

  https://github.com/jpadilla/pyjwt/commit/9d980786c9080ad99ae221ea5b77397434c3c50c

bp json-web-tokens

Change-Id: I6b4b565fc7160fffe5e445673ccea9b3bba584d6

commit_message:
Add test fixture for the JWS key repository

This commit introduces a fixture similar to what we use for Fernet
token keys. This will be set and used for JWS specific tests.

bp json-web-tokens

Change-Id: Iaf7dcba0c45ced72f1c2e442775592670bf941eb

commit_message:
Add project_id in group list and show API

Add ``project_id`` to response body of list groups with detail and show
group detail APIs.

Depends-On: I190cc67a001ffce2a533480e6e39e26cd3f981df
Change-Id: I3bc34a30b02f8a1ec2c5fecbcde6bd369c8e4a76
Implements: blueprint add-project-id-to-group-response

commit_message:
Fix iPXE boot interface with ipxe_enabled=False

If ipxe_enabled=False, Ironic still tried to download images into
the TFTP location, which could fail. This patch fixes it.

Story: #2004905
Task: #29253
Change-Id: I5958eeb0d9de59a34145dd899354bf2a1a115dde

commit_message:
Fix invalid exception module usage

This commit fixes an invalid exception module usage. We don't have
InvalidParam class in `tempest.exceptions` module but in
`tempest.lib.exceptions` module.

Change-Id: I22b535c4a632d9f66cf2a85a5ff83b1f0aaf1497

This change removes the assumption that ip and iptables are always in
the same location on any distro by setting the specific tool path per OS
package manager type.

This adapts the pattern set here:
https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/blob/fc9a2d03dc176eaa6ed1e314202583b0a8191302/tests/roles/bootstrap-host/defaults/main.yml#L106-L118

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add path variable for different distros

This change removes the assumption that ip and iptables are always in
the same location on any distro by setting the specific tool path per OS
package manager type.

This adapts the pattern set here:
https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/blob/fc9a2d03dc176eaa6ed1e314202583b0a8191302/tests/roles/bootstrap-host/defaults/main.yml#L106-L118

Change-Id: If7ddd8f2afb8c990f2b5117947f103626663ad21
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Fixes for Unicode characters in python 2 requests
messages: [{'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2019-01-29 14:10:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-02-01 02:51:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-29 14:10:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes for Unicode characters in python 2 requests

urljoin() util function uses str() which will trigger an exception on
Unicode characters in python 2, use string type from six to support both
versions

Furthermore, HttpException would trigger an exception when logging an
error, as __unicode__() may call super().__str__() with Unicode
characters. Replace the call with similar code (returning the message)

Sample command to trigger both errors in current code:
openstack port delete does_not_exist™

Conflicts:
	openstack/tests/unit/test_utils.py
	openstack/utils.py

Change-Id: Iedc47fa74e89f70e6f5e846f8a564bf1db40228a
Story: 2004356
Task: 29066
(cherry picked from commit c7bbaf32f3e450d233516f4a2e36077089be41a1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes for Unicode characters in python 2 requests

urljoin() util function uses str() which will trigger an exception on
Unicode characters in python 2, use string type from six to support both
versions

Furthermore, HttpException would trigger an exception when logging an
error, as __unicode__() may call super().__str__() with Unicode
characters. Replace the call with similar code (returning the message)

Sample command to trigger both errors in current code:
openstack port delete does_not_exist™

Conflicts:
	openstack/tests/unit/test_utils.py
	openstack/utils.py

Change-Id: Iedc47fa74e89f70e6f5e846f8a564bf1db40228a
Story: 2004356
Task: 29066
(cherry picked from commit c7bbaf32f3e450d233516f4a2e36077089be41a1)

commit_message:
Modify the error message when unsetting gateway and setting FIP

When assiging FIP without router between the external and
removing an external gateway information from a using router,
openstackclient just return http code.
The patch shows the correct failure message when these errors displays.

Change-Id: I3546bd6b63d10db2c0ae2d643ee1aa61cd83cf29
Closes-Bug: 1760405
Closes-Bug: 1757063
(cherry picked from commit d82c8f930606f51f671eb4c142174500f8efb085)

commit_message:
Fixes for Unicode characters in python 2 requests

urljoin() util function uses str() which will trigger an exception on
Unicode characters in python 2, use string type from six to support both
versions

Furthermore, HttpException would trigger an exception when logging an
error, as __unicode__() may call super().__str__() with Unicode
characters. Replace the call with similar code (returning the message)

Sample command to trigger both errors in current code:
openstack port delete does_not_exist™

Conflicts:
	openstack/tests/unit/test_utils.py

commit_message:
Break out tripleo-admin creation to its own role

This removes some inline ansible from the mistral workflow, and allows
this role to be reused in other contexts (such as undercloud install)

Change-Id: Id89cc920e165c2103707609fd37639c3032cc8ea
Partial-Bug: #1813832

commit_message:
Fix functional tests on stable/rocky

Update jobs in .zuul.yaml to run stable/rocky code as inspired by
Ifaef01ec5f348b7bd7466ec6c662a204d78af2d3

Also remove the nodepool-functional-py35-src jobs as this is only needed
on master changes (and failing with stable branch)

Change-Id: Ie537022f0446f5564a4ca45b931bb707c2614405

[{'created': '2019-01-31 17:21:53.000000000', 'message': 'Add path variable for different distros

This change removes the assumption that ip and iptables are always in
the same location on any distro by setting the specific tool path per OS
package manager type.

This adapts the pattern set here:
https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/blob/fc9a2d03dc176eaa6ed1e314202583b0a8191302/tests/roles/bootstrap-host/defaults/main.yml#L106-L118

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add path variable for different distros

This change removes the assumption that ip and iptables are always in
the same location on any distro by setting the specific tool path per OS
package manager type.

This adapts the pattern set here:
https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/blob/fc9a2d03dc176eaa6ed1e314202583b0a8191302/tests/roles/bootstrap-host/defaults/main.yml#L106-L118

Change-Id: Ie627a5b5ec3984ea6883e184f55a2fb2034e2d92
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add configuration options for JWS provider

This commit only introduces a new group for JWT configuration options
that are specific to JWS. Even though the configuration group is named
after JWT, the configuration options are specific to JWS. If keystone
supports JWE token in the future, we will add new configuration
options for key specific to that implementation as opposed to reusing
JWS keys.

It does not wire anything up to the actual token provider code. That
will come in a later patch.

bp json-web-tokens

Change-Id: I8c9b249138a32f096d5edc84772099e9d780687b

commit_message:
Update greenlet to 0.4.15

Over the 0.4.13 this provides the following relevant fixes:

- Workaround a gcc bug on ppc64
- Fixed support for ppc64 ABI

While there were also two new architectures added, no other architecture
had any code change.

a#

Change-Id: I7931aa14b58be99fa1b2cfe4293b0c20770b65f4

commit_message:
Initial support for properties managed by pcs 0.10

pcs0.10 removed support for 'pcs property --node'. The command to
be used is 'pcs node attribute'

We cannot detect the pcs version via facter as that breaks when pcs
is not installed at the moment puppet is run.

Doing it with an additional yum call like
https://github.com/fsalum/puppet-redis/blob/master/lib/facter/redis_version.rb#L50
seems also suboptimal.

Change-Id: I27b8aa930a7413069539eb4fac13c41822049889

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-24 23:08:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix using template cell urls with nova-manage

When nova-manage went to validate the transport-url given in config or on the
command line, it was not doing the translation before passing the url to the
oslo.messaging parse routine to check it. This exposes the format functions
from the CellMapping object, and makes our _validate_transport_url() format
the url before passing it to parse.

This also adds a test that makes sure the template makes it into the database
(as a template) and that it gets loaded out in translated form with an
object load.

Change-Id: I40a435b8e97c8552c2f5f0ca3a24de2edd9f81bd
Closes-Bug: #1812196
(cherry picked from commit edd1cd9ee4d149b01a388f03fb423374020033d7)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix using template cell urls with nova-manage

When nova-manage went to validate the transport-url given in config or on the
command line, it was not doing the translation before passing the url to the
oslo.messaging parse routine to check it. This exposes the format functions
from the CellMapping object, and makes our _validate_transport_url() format
the url before passing it to parse.

This also adds a test that makes sure the template makes it into the database
(as a template) and that it gets loaded out in translated form with an
object load.

Change-Id: I40a435b8e97c8552c2f5f0ca3a24de2edd9f81bd
Closes-Bug: #1812196
(cherry picked from commit edd1cd9ee4d149b01a388f03fb423374020033d7)

[{'created': '2018-10-28 22:36:56.000000000', 'message': 'Search ports with matching subnet

On ipam_request_address, it will try to find existing Neutron
ports if any. If there is no existing Neutron ports, kuryr will
create one. Kuryr will search ports with matching IP address first.
If the first search is not successful, it will do a second search
to find ports with matching mac address.
This commit improve the second search by matching the subnet_id
as well as the mac address. This is because things will go wrong
if the port is in a different subnet (e.g. an ipv6 address is
requested while the port is in a v4 subnet).

Change-Id: I1eaa9c87079f1c57babbe08ae52ed69a44cfa9aa
Related-Bug: #1800375
'}, {'created': '2018-10-29 04:49:02.000000000', 'message': 'Search ports with matching subnet

If the first search is not successful, it will do a second search

This commit improve the second search by matching the subnet_id

Change-Id: I1eaa9c87079f1c57babbe08ae52ed69a44cfa9aa

'}]
commit_message:
Search ports with matching subnet

On ipam_request_address, it will try to find existing Neutron
ports if any. If there is no existing Neutron ports, kuryr will
create one. Kuryr will search ports with matching IP address first.
If the first search is not successful, it will do a second search
to find ports with matching mac address.
This commit improve the second search by matching the subnet_id
as well as the mac address. This is because things will go wrong
if the port is in a different subnet (e.g. an ipv6 address is
requested while the port is in a v4 subnet).

Change-Id: I1eaa9c87079f1c57babbe08ae52ed69a44cfa9aa
Related-Bug: #1800375

commit_message:
Update mapping policies for system reader

The mapping policies were not taking the default roles work we did
last release into account. This commit changes the default policies
to rely on the ``reader`` role for get and list mappings. Subsequent
patches will incorporate:

 - system member
 - system admin
 - domain users
 - project users

 Related-Bug: 1804519
 Related-Bug: 1804521

Change-Id: I2fe143dc75dd702665ea1ba643d4ae7700b748ac

commit_message:
Fixed some unneeded domain_id handling

When you are acting on a user or project with an id
there is no need for a domain_id as well, since
IDs are unique across all domains. Names are not.

Change-Id: Ib49ac4d3e1d3e0869195a67ecc922aae24e2a44e

[{'created': '2019-01-29 02:35:33.000000000', 'message': 'Change how O_TMPFILE support is detected

Previously o_tmpfile support was detected by checking the
kernel version as it was officially introduced in XFS in 3.15.
The problem is that RHEL has backported the support to at least
RHEL 7.6 but the kernel version is not updated.

This patch changes o_tmpfile is deteced by actually attempting to
open a file with the O_TMPFILE flag and keeps the information cached
in the object server so that the check only happens once while process
is running.

Change-Id: I3599e2ab257bcd99467aee83b747939afac639d8

commit_message:
Change how O_TMPFILE support is detected

Previously o_tmpfile support was detected by checking the
kernel version as it was officially introduced in XFS in 3.15.
The problem is that RHEL has backported the support to at least
RHEL 7.6 but the kernel version is not updated.

This patch changes o_tmpfile is detected by actually attempting to
open a file with the O_TMPFILE flag and keeps the information cached
in DiskFileManager so that the check only happens once while process
is running.

Change-Id: I3599e2ab257bcd99467aee83b747939afac639d8

commit_message:
Do not waste CI resources on changes to migration/*

When a patch only changes files in migration/* we do not need to run
our full CI suit on that patch since we do not have coverage for the
migration scripts upstream.

Change-Id: Ia1d516240a525ead6ff87cdf39993350e5113166
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
flatten database service MySQL Client

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration.

With this patch the baremetal version of database service MySQL Client
has been removed.

Change-Id: I855524f30cfe3c8cdab6c52a67fba0dee157103d
Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening

are reported in api code, however it is appropriate there
to redefine methods like ``index`` and ``show`` in different

commit_message:
Address E0102 pylint errors

When pylint is run against manila codebase E0102 errors
are reported in api code, however it is appropriate there
to redefine methods like ``index`` and ``show`` in different
microversion contexts.

Add comments to inform pylint that these redefinitions are
OK.

Change-Id: I295e5b3332ce28811f92487cfafae06568d07871

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-30 15:54:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add the ability to set the JVM heap size

This change makes it possible for users to set the `elastic_heap_size_default`
value. Before this change, the option was unreachable due to a series of facts
ganerated template values. The options `elastic_heap_size` or `logstash_heap_size`
have also been exposed giving deployers the ability to define service specific
heap sizes as needed.

Change-Id: Ida3a57fdcff388f8e4bb3f325b787205a6183970
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add the ability to set the JVM heap size

This change makes it possible for users to set the `elastic_heap_size_default`
value. Before this change, the option was unreachable due to a series of facts
ganerated template values. The options `elastic_heap_size` or `logstash_heap_size`
have also been exposed giving deployers the ability to define service specific
heap sizes as needed.

Change-Id: Ida3a57fdcff388f8e4bb3f325b787205a6183970
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

[{'created': '2019-01-18 09:12:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fix incompatible version handling in BuildRequest

The BuildRequest object code assumed that IncompatibleObjectVersion
exception has a objver field that contains the object version. This
assumption is not true. The unit test made another mistake serializing
the function object obj_to_primitive instead of serializing the result
of the call of obj_to_primitive. This caused a false positive test
covering the error in the implementation as well.

Closes-Bug: #1812177

Change-Id: I1ef4a23aa2bf5cb46b481045f3d968f62f74606d
(cherry picked from commit 975f0156137e37f7a9139c0268547d79dcc3c43c)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incompatible version handling in BuildRequest

The BuildRequest object code assumed that IncompatibleObjectVersion
exception has a objver field that contains the object version. This
assumption is not true. The unit test made another mistake serializing
the function object obj_to_primitive instead of serializing the result
of the call of obj_to_primitive. This caused a false positive test
covering the error in the implementation as well.

Closes-Bug: #1812177

Change-Id: I1ef4a23aa2bf5cb46b481045f3d968f62f74606d
(cherry picked from commit 975f0156137e37f7a9139c0268547d79dcc3c43c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-13 18:30:16.000000000', 'message': 'Force all fdb entries update after ovs-vswitchd restart

When ovs-vswitchd process is restarted neutron-ovs-agent will
handle it and reconfigure all ports and openflows in bridges.
Unfortunatelly when tunnel networks are used together with
L2pop mechanism driver, this driver will not notice that agent
lost all openflow config and will not send all fdb entries which
should be added on host.

In such case L2pop mechanism driver should behave in same way like
when neutron-ovs-agent is restarted and send all fdb_entries to
agent.

This patch adds "simulate" of agent start flag when ovs_restart is
handled thus neutron-server will send all fdb_entries to agent and
tunnels openflow rules can be reconfigured properly.

Change-Id: I5f1471e20bbad90c4cdcbc6c06d3a4412db55b2a
Closes-bug: #1804842
(cherry picked from commit ae031d18866a9e3652f4fc122f120915209a7b29)
(cherry picked from commit dd6a52529e483829e48e2ed62d10bb98307fd3c9)
'}]
commit_message:
Force all fdb entries update after ovs-vswitchd restart

When ovs-vswitchd process is restarted neutron-ovs-agent will
handle it and reconfigure all ports and openflows in bridges.
Unfortunatelly when tunnel networks are used together with
L2pop mechanism driver, this driver will not notice that agent
lost all openflow config and will not send all fdb entries which
should be added on host.

In such case L2pop mechanism driver should behave in same way like
when neutron-ovs-agent is restarted and send all fdb_entries to
agent.

This patch adds "simulate" of agent start flag when ovs_restart is
handled thus neutron-server will send all fdb_entries to agent and
tunnels openflow rules can be reconfigured properly.

Change-Id: I5f1471e20bbad90c4cdcbc6c06d3a4412db55b2a
Closes-bug: #1804842
(cherry picked from commit ae031d18866a9e3652f4fc122f120915209a7b29)
(cherry picked from commit dd6a52529e483829e48e2ed62d10bb98307fd3c9)

commit_message:
Add pre-fixes to the Selenium jobs and remove "|| true"

This adds xxx-job name prefixes to the Selenium jobs for consistency

This will also remove the "|| true" suffix that was added temporarily to
ensure the Kibana selenium job did not error. The fix for the issue
was merged so the quick fix is no longer needed and may prevent an
error when an issue actually occurs.
Change-Id: I16881974cbf618b31813964b17c090dbfe33fe51

commit_message:
Add configuration to enable/disable L7,L4 protocols

Currently not all Provider drivers support L7 in Octavia.
Until the flavors option is not enabled, it is proposed to skip
L7 in favor of L4( specifically TCP ) protocol tests for the provider
drivers.

Change-Id: I07b4f7038d71d684c23885c89257af2711a442a0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-05 22:02:03.000000000', 'message': 'object-auditor: change "concurrency" to "auditor_workers" in configs

Most Swift daemons use "workers" or "<type>_workers" to control the
number of subprocesses they spawn, and "concurrency" to control the
number of units of concurrent work per process. The only exceptions
are the object auditor, object updater, and container updater, which
use "concurrency" to mean number-of-subprocesses and don't do
concurrent work in each subprocess.

I think this gets a bit confusing, and that Swift should pick one
standard and stick with it.

This commit makes "concurrency" and "auditor_workers" equivalent in
the object auditor's config files, and updates all the sample configs
to say "auditor_workers". There should be no impact for upgrades.

Change-Id: I41b357e2fe951c2b0aeb8bfb5c18c0d1ba5eade3
'}, {'created': '2019-01-22 18:45:53.000000000', 'message': 'object-auditor: change "concurrency" to "auditor_workers" in configs

Most Swift daemons use "workers" or "<type>_workers" to control the
number of subprocesses they spawn, and "concurrency" to control the
number of units of concurrent work per process. The only exceptions
are the object auditor and container updater, which use "concurrency"
to mean number-of-subprocesses and don't do concurrent work in each
subprocess.

I think this gets a bit confusing, and that Swift should pick one
standard and stick with it.

This commit makes "concurrency" and "auditor_workers" equivalent in
the object auditor's config files, and updates all the sample configs
to say "auditor_workers". There should be no impact for upgrades.

Related-Change: I17e18088e61f664e1b9942d66423666d0cae1689
Change-Id: I41b357e2fe951c2b0aeb8bfb5c18c0d1ba5eade3
'}, {'created': '2019-01-22 18:53:09.000000000', 'message': 'object-auditor: change "concurrency" to "auditor_workers" in configs

commit_message:
object-auditor: change "concurrency" to "auditor_workers" in configs

Most Swift daemons use "workers" or "<type>_workers" to control the
number of subprocesses they spawn, and "concurrency" to control the
number of units of concurrent work per process. The only exceptions
are the object auditor and container updater, which use "concurrency"
to mean number-of-subprocesses and don't do concurrent work in each
subprocess.

I think this gets a bit confusing, and that Swift should pick one
standard and stick with it.

This commit makes "concurrency" and "auditor_workers" equivalent in
the object auditor's config files, and updates all the sample configs
to say "auditor_workers". There should be no impact for upgrades.

Related-Change: I17e18088e61f664e1b9942d66423666d0cae1689
Change-Id: I41b357e2fe951c2b0aeb8bfb5c18c0d1ba5eade3

commit_message:
Allow users to format output results to the yaml format.

Allow users to format output results to the yaml format
by using the flag --yaml.

Passing this flag prefixing each results with dash in the stdout.

Change-Id: I460c17704c5311d6fb422d5e56be8080344ab986
