messages: [{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-01-31 17:31:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-01-31 18:17:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-01-31 19:31:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-31 17:31:45.000000000', 'message': "Exit trap cleanup in docstheme-build-translated.sh

Add a catch-all `cleanup` exit trap to docstheme-build-translated.sh.
The script creates interim artifacts in doc/source (which it arguably
shouldn't do) like .pot files and .rst sources modified with index
headers pointing to translations. Previously, if the doc build failed,
these artifacts would be left behind, creating a mess for a developer
attempting to make and commit doc changes locally. This patch
accumulates the existing cleanups into an exit trap so they happen
whether the script succeeds or fails.

Developers of openstackdocstheme itself may disable this cleanup trap by
setting the DOCSTHEME_BUILD_TRANSLATED__NO_CLEANUP environment variable
to a nonempty value.

Change-Id: If48c5705c34f940e78e3a34e602e48496a397629
"}]
commit_message:
Exit trap cleanup in docstheme-build-translated.sh

Add a catch-all `cleanup` exit trap to docstheme-build-translated.sh.
The script creates interim artifacts in doc/source (which it arguably
shouldn't do) like .pot files and .rst sources modified with index
headers pointing to translations. Previously, if the doc build failed,
these artifacts would be left behind, creating a mess for a developer
attempting to make and commit doc changes locally. This patch
accumulates the existing cleanups into an exit trap so they happen
whether the script succeeds or fails.

Developers of openstackdocstheme itself may disable this cleanup trap by
setting the DOCSTHEME_BUILD_TRANSLATED__NO_CLEANUP environment variable
to a nonempty value.

Change-Id: If48c5705c34f940e78e3a34e602e48496a397629

commit_message:
Allocation API: conductor API (without HA and take over)

This change introduces the two RPC calls required for the allocation
API: create_allocation and destroy_allocation.

The nodes RPC is updated to:
* Prevent instance_uuid deletion if a node has an allocation and is
  not in an updatable state.
* Delete allocation when instance_uuid is deleted and the node is
  in an updatable state.
* Delete allocation when a node is unprovisioned and instance_uuid
  is thus cleared.

Change-Id: I45815727f970c3d7fe51bb78d8e162a374d12e04
Story: #2004341
Task: #27987

commit_message:
Make sahara (now core only) usable as requirement

Starting from Stein, sahara.git contains only the core (services and base
classes) of Sahara. The code of plugin was moved into its own repository.
Each plugin depends on Sahara core, so in order to use it as dependency
it must be added as requirement somehow.
No additional splits are planned right now, which means no sahara-lib,
which means adding sahara to blacklist.txt

* Is the library actively maintained?
  Yes

* Is the library good code?
  Yes, it is has been part of OpenStack for few years

* Is the library python 3 compatible?
  Yes

* Is the library license compatible?
  Yes,Apache 2

* Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest /
  Fedora latest)?
  It will be as part of the sahara release

* Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
  global-requirements.txt?
  No

* Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure
  setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?
  Yes, Sahara

* If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process does it use
  the cycle-with-intermediary release type?
  Right now it uses cycle-with-rc, which still allows for intermediate releases

Change-Id: Ia8f2ccfb01492c109fe7d2810f6b441d644c2572

subject: Change default for [kafka]num_processors to 1
messages: [{'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-01-29 09:39:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-01-29 17:22:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2019-01-31 18:35:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nmuch better'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-29 09:39:11.000000000', 'message': 'Change default for [kafka]num_processors to 1

Currently the default for [kafka]num_processors is 0. This can lead to
the situation where monasca-persister starts but nothing happens
because no processes are started.
This can happen very easy in the default configuration where the
"num_processors" value in the different
sections ([kafka_alarm_history], [kafka_events], [kafka_metrics]) is
set to:

num_processors = $kafka.num_processors

which means that in the default case, 0 processes are started.
This is fixed now because the default for [kafka]num_processors is now
1.

Change-Id: I2c8ed56bbe91648543044201d7b6320f88a724c7
'}]
commit_message:
Change default for [kafka]num_processors to 1

Currently the default for [kafka]num_processors is 0. This can lead to
the situation where monasca-persister starts but nothing happens
because no processes are started.
This can happen very easy in the default configuration where the
"num_processors" value in the different
sections ([kafka_alarm_history], [kafka_events], [kafka_metrics]) is
set to:

num_processors = $kafka.num_processors

which means that in the default case, 0 processes are started.
This is fixed now because the default for [kafka]num_processors is now
1.

Change-Id: I2c8ed56bbe91648543044201d7b6320f88a724c7

Sorry, hit the wrong button there!'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-01-22 13:38:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I was looking into a test for this, was thinking we could compare the major version from glance.version.version_info to the first character of glance.db.migration.CURRENT_RELEASE (do we know what's going to happen after the 'z' release? do we start at 'a' again?), but pbr is still reporting master's major version as 17.  I guess that won't change until we do a release from master.  I wonder if we should do a scratch release or something after the stable branch is cut?  Maybe Sean or Doug will have an idea."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-22 14:02:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

PBR should be giving a higher version number after this had merged:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610560/

There is some description of the mechanics of that patch here:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-01-22 17:27:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I put up a test: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632517/ based on this patch.  I think it shows that pbr still thinks master is at 17 (or it may show that I don't know how to use pbr correctly)."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-01-22 18:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I put up a test: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632517/ based on
 > this patch.  I think it shows that pbr still thinks master is at 17
 > (or it may show that I don't know how to use pbr correctly).

I get 17.1.0 instead of 17.0.0 when I run "python setup.py --version" on glance master, which is what I would expect with the pbr instruction to increment the version number for a feature. To get to 18 you'll have to create a patch similar to Sean's that uses the pbr instruction to indicate there is a breaking change.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-01-22 19:13:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Sean: I went back and read through your email and the pbr docs.  Your patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610560/ contains 'Sem-Ver: feature' in the commit message which only causes a minor version increment.  I think we need 'Sem-Ver: api-break' to trigger the major version increment.

Is there any reason *not* to have the major version incremented in master as soon as master opens for development (i.e., after the stable branch is cut at RC-time)?"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-01-22 19:15:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

... and I just noticed that Doug already pointed this out!'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-22 19:20:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Is there any reason *not* to have the major version incremented in
 > master as soon as master opens for development (i.e., after the
 > stable branch is cut at RC-time)?

Not all repos would want to bump up the major version right away, so that is not done be default. In most cases, the version number just needs to be higher to allow upgrading from the last full release, so a feature bump is sufficient for that.

If that does not work for our case here, then in that case you can do a major bump.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-01-28 17:41:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

OK, here's what I think we need to do timing-wise:
1 - merge https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632517/ (adds the test to make sure pbr and the alembic migration constant are in sync)
2 - merge https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633011/ (beta release of glance, will make release version==18 , which should cause (1) to fail and wedge the gate
3 - merge this change (which will correct the alembic migration constant and restore glance tests to passing)"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-01-29 07:53:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Looks reasonable to me. I can't really judge though if it's a complte fix.

Even if the code itself doesn't require/follow depends-on with releases, I think it's clearer and 'more automatic' if we added a Depends-On here."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-01-30 16:33:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

NOTE: The emergency fallback (in case this patch doesn't fix the failing glance unit tests once the beta is released) will be to revert https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632517/"}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-01-30 21:34:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-01-31 00:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Failure is the subunit parser problem.
On the plus side, you can see from http://logs.openstack.org/83/624983/3/check/openstack-tox-py27/1d88382/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-01-30_23_48_39_831885 that the test we added for catching a version mismatch is working!'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-01-31 00:50:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-01-31 11:56:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Drop monasca_persister/LICENSE

The LICENSE file is already in the root directory of the git project
so there is no need to have an identical file in the
monasac_persister/ subdir.

Change-Id: I2f3b54418192406cdb633cc43cdd6eab3a7683ed

commit_message:
Add support for CA certificate parameter

When using Ansible OpenStack modules, if OS_CACERT is defined, then this
will be passed as the cacert module argument.

This ensures that non-standard CA certificate paths can be used.

Change-Id: I2a2575b1fb0f149cc13c44526fc0167e68e07aab
Story: 2004911
Task: 29261

commit_message:
Fail if too many nameservers are provided

The nameservers are limited by neutron to the max configured servers
which is 5 by default. Since we do not offer a way to tune this value,
let's fail the user early if they are providing too many nameservers.
If a user wants to provide more than 5, they can do so by increasing the
max_dns_nameservers in neutron and setting the DnsServers via extra
environment files.

Change-Id: I51ed6f8bb109df7f9038bbf691097d50ce9e54b3
Closes-Bug: 1812919

[{'created': '2019-01-31 07:15:32.000000000', 'message': 'Use with keyword for opening target file

Simply reading a file is dangerous, it might happens that the file
might be open but not closed will leads to ResourceWarning: unclosed
file error, It is necessary to use with keyword which will close the
file first and then allow it to open it.

Change-Id: Ia48c1cb0e436ac2c53fc6bd46c4a906c70a51325
'}, {'created': '2019-01-31 11:08:41.000000000', 'message': 'Use with keyword for opening target file

Simply reading a file is dangerous, it might happens that the file
might be open but not closed will leads to ResourceWarning: unclosed
file error, It is necessary to use with keyword which will close the
file first and then allow it to open it.

Changing r mode to rb mode as in Python3, While r mode is used then
it reads the file based on file encoding provided but with rb mode
it reads the stream as a binary which avoides the encoding issue.

Change-Id: Ia48c1cb0e436ac2c53fc6bd46c4a906c70a51325
'}]
commit_message:
Use with keyword for opening target file

Simply reading a file is dangerous, it might happens that the file
might be open but not closed will leads to ResourceWarning: unclosed
file error, It is necessary to use with keyword which will close the
file first and then allow it to open it.

Changing r mode to rb mode as in Python3, While r mode is used then
it reads the file based on file encoding provided but with rb mode
it reads the stream as a binary which avoides the encoding issue.

Change-Id: Ia48c1cb0e436ac2c53fc6bd46c4a906c70a51325

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-22 21:56:19.000000000', 'message': "WIP noop package installations inside containers

While deploying on a rhel8 os beta + pure f28 containers we noticed that
during docker-puppet or during docker-puppet-apply.sh dnf is invoked to
install packages (in this case it was specifically MySQL-python).

It makes zero sense to install packages inside a container because if
you don't commit the container the content will be lost at restart
anyway and so the installed package will be missing anyway.

root 60586 0.0 0.0 13948 2936 ? Ss 15:29 0:00 \_ /bin/bash /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh
root 60623 6.8 0.7 366532 118236 ? Sl 15:29 0:04 \_ /usr/bin/ruby-mri /usr/bin/puppet apply --summarize --detailed-exitcodes --color=false --logdest syslog --logdest console --modulepath=/etc/puppet/modules:/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules --tags file,file_line,concat,augeas,cron,cinder_config,cinder_type,file,concat,file_line /etc/config.pp
root 60879 24.1 0.8 613968 137800 ? Ss 15:29 0:11 \_ /usr/bin/python3 /usr/bin/dnf -d 0 -e 1 -y install MySQL-python

The packages *must* be preinstalled in the container images all the
time, assuming we can invoke yum/dnf inside the container makes little
sense.
The reason for this is that this hiera key should not have any effect
inside a container:
[root@win1 hieradata]# hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml tripleo::packages::enable_install
true

Tested this change by redeploying a standalone env (which forces package
installation to true) and observed no dnf calls like the ones described
above.

Change-Id: I2bd247af2b54f3a834cdc8a2f253600527c7acd8
Closes-Bug: #1812923
"}, {'created': '2019-01-26 10:19:38.000000000', 'message': "noop package installations inside containers

While deploying on a rhel8 os beta + pure f28 containers we noticed that
during docker-puppet or during docker-puppet-apply.sh dnf is invoked to
install packages (in this case it was specifically MySQL-python).

you don't commit the container the content will be lost at restart
anyway and so the installed package will be missing anyway.

root 60586 0.0 0.0 13948 2936 ? Ss 15:29 0:00 \_ /bin/bash /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh
root 60623 6.8 0.7 366532 118236 ? Sl 15:29 0:04 \_ /usr/bin/ruby-mri /usr/bin/puppet apply --summarize --detailed-exitcodes --color=false --logdest syslog --logdest console --modulepath=/etc/puppet/modules:/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules --tags file,file_line,concat,augeas,cron,cinder_config,cinder_type,file,concat,file_line /etc/config.pp
root 60879 24.1 0.8 613968 137800 ? Ss 15:29 0:11 \_ /usr/bin/python3 /usr/bin/dnf -d 0 -e 1 -y install MySQL-python

The packages *must* be preinstalled in the container images all the
time, assuming we can invoke yum/dnf inside the container makes little
sense.
The reason for this is that this hiera key should not have any effect
inside a container:
[root@win1 hieradata]# hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml tripleo::packages::enable_install
true

Tested this change by redeploying a standalone env (which forces package
installation to true) and observed no dnf calls like the ones described
above.

Change-Id: I2bd247af2b54f3a834cdc8a2f253600527c7acd8
Closes-Bug: #1812923
"}]
commit_message:
noop package installations inside containers

While deploying on a rhel8 os beta + pure f28 containers we noticed that
during docker-puppet or during docker-puppet-apply.sh dnf is invoked to
install packages (in this case it was specifically MySQL-python).

It makes zero sense to install packages inside a container because if
you don't commit the container the content will be lost at restart
anyway and so the installed package will be missing anyway.

root 60586 0.0 0.0 13948 2936 ? Ss 15:29 0:00 \_ /bin/bash /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh
root 60623 6.8 0.7 366532 118236 ? Sl 15:29 0:04 \_ /usr/bin/ruby-mri /usr/bin/puppet apply --summarize --detailed-exitcodes --color=false --logdest syslog --logdest console --modulepath=/etc/puppet/modules:/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules --tags file,file_line,concat,augeas,cron,cinder_config,cinder_type,file,concat,file_line /etc/config.pp
root 60879 24.1 0.8 613968 137800 ? Ss 15:29 0:11 \_ /usr/bin/python3 /usr/bin/dnf -d 0 -e 1 -y install MySQL-python

The packages *must* be preinstalled in the container images all the
time, assuming we can invoke yum/dnf inside the container makes little
sense.
The reason for this is that this hiera key should not have any effect
inside a container:
[root@win1 hieradata]# hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml tripleo::packages::enable_install
true

Tested this change by redeploying a standalone env (which forces package
installation to true) and observed no dnf calls like the ones described
above.

Change-Id: I2bd247af2b54f3a834cdc8a2f253600527c7acd8
Closes-Bug: #1812923

Some of our tasks and handlers need to be run as root but were
previously missing the become: true option. This change addresses this
to ensure the appropriate tasks and handlers are run as an admin user.

Change-Id: I9cf00809e8725d9220bc993c8fd6602e19ed7aa3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix become for tasks and handlers

Some of our tasks and handlers need to be run as root but were
previously missing the become: true option. This change addresses this
to ensure the appropriate tasks and handlers are run as an admin user.

Change-Id: I9cf00809e8725d9220bc993c8fd6602e19ed7aa3

commit_message:
tripleo_deploy: symlink ansible-playbook

In RHEL8, we'll have /usr/bin/ansible-playbook provided by ansible
package.
Everywhere in TripleO we rely on /usr/bin/ansible-playbook but the
ansible-python3 package in Fedora 28 doesn't provide it.
Until it does, we have a temporary workaround that will create a symlink
only if the file doesn't exist and if ansible-playbook3 is here.

Change-Id: I040345ffb76a14035e6100c4e61a9aea07b690c6
Related-Bug: #1812837

docker: add reset_connection

reset ssh connection to pick up docker group after the task that add the
deployment user to docker group.

Change-Id: Ifb9a9ad6c467b8f244665696ed02cdbdc7f9a9de

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-29 19:22:18.000000000', 'message': 'yum_update_buildah: add retry x3

The "buildah run" randomly fails on centos7 kernel, with:
standard_init_linux.go:203: exec user process caused "no such file or directory"

We think it's related to:
https://github.com/containers/libpod/issues/1844

To workaround this issue, we'll retry 3 times with a delay of 3 seconds
between each "buildah run" command which would fail to produce an exit
code of 0.

Change-Id: Ic50fd359c9bf50a6e0247d7743b26191d2f3dcb5
'}]
commit_message:
yum_update_buildah: add retry x3

The "buildah run" randomly fails on centos7 kernel, with:
standard_init_linux.go:203: exec user process caused "no such file or directory"

We think it's related to:
https://github.com/containers/libpod/issues/1844

To workaround this issue, we'll retry 3 times with a delay of 3 seconds
between each "buildah run" command which would fail to produce an exit
code of 0.

Change-Id: Ic50fd359c9bf50a6e0247d7743b26191d2f3dcb5

commit_message:
Fix introspection data lookup

Accessing ironic-introspection data from swift doesn't work with
utils.get_swift_client. This fix uses an auth session object and
swiftclient's Connection class instead.

Change-Id: Ie8c6cccb8fd9debf288cc449647dff5225f09e3e

commit_message:
flatten haproxy service configuration

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration.

With this patch the baremetal version of haproxy services has been removed.

Change-Id: Id55ae44a7b1b5f08b40170f7406e14973fa93639
Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening

subject: Remove keystone admin endpoint from apache
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-23 15:08:46.000000000', 'message': 'Remove keystone admin endpoint from apache

This removes the admin endpoint from apache, leaving only the "public"
one. This way, only haproxy still listens on the admin port (35357), but
forwards it towards the same keystone endpoint.

Change-Id: I5517150af1e2fabfa71f67ea00030f54080c31c5
Depends-On: I577373b5ff110c47bc4dc350ca753b7a1957554f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove keystone admin endpoint from apache

This removes the admin endpoint from apache, leaving only the "public"
one. This way, only haproxy still listens on the admin port (35357), but
forwards it towards the same keystone endpoint.

Change-Id: I5517150af1e2fabfa71f67ea00030f54080c31c5

This patch fixes a parameter mismatch bug when using the CKM_AES_GCM
mechanism.  This bug also renames the 'generate_iv' option to
'aes_gcm_generate_iv' to reflect the fact that it only applies to
the CKM_AES_GCM mechanism since IVs will always be generated when
using CKM_AES_CBC.

"}, {'created': '2019-01-17 22:02:31.000000000', 'message': "Fix CKM_AES_GCM encryption

mechanism.  This bug also renames the 'generate_iv' option to
'aes_gcm_generate_iv' to reflect the fact that it only applies to
the CKM_AES_GCM mechanism since IVs will always be generated when

commit_message:
Fix CKM_AES_GCM encryption

This patch fixes a parameter mismatch bug when using the CKM_AES_GCM
mechanism.  This bug also renames the 'generate_iv' option to
'aes_gcm_generate_iv' to reflect the fact that it only applies to
the CKM_AES_GCM mechanism since IVs will always be generated when
using CKM_AES_CBC.

Change-Id: Iaa94b5cf2b2f77aaed72ec6b8b11e5ccf1fc3cca
(cherry picked from commit e4d09f5848b3cb9fc8ce0905a2f91f9b2ca36f41)

During the rocky release, kayobe is moving to using a directory for the
kolla-ansible inventories, rather than a file. The forward upgrade path
is handled, but downgrade is not. If using a single environment and
switching between releases, it's possible that a directory generated by
rocky will be present for queens, and cause an error.

commit_message:
Handle existing kolla-ansible inventory directories

Stable branches only

During the rocky release, kayobe is moving to using a directory for the
kolla-ansible inventories, rather than a file. The forward upgrade path
is handled, but downgrade is not. If using a single environment and
switching between releases, it's possible that a directory generated by
rocky will be present for queens, and cause an error.

This change deletes any inventory directories found.

Change-Id: Ia4e88a544d96eeb621135483693c2ff2ee9bf5d7
Story: 2004806
Task: 28961

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-30 21:30:31.000000000', 'message': 'Consistency Group Snapshots detail url is wrong

The link in the consistency group table for "detail" is a mismatch
for the corresponding value in the urls.py file, causing cg snapshots
clicks to not load details for the user.

This bug was introduced in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/429506
where the link in tables.py was changed from:
"horizon:project:volumes:cg_snapshots:cg_snapshot_detail"
to
"horizon:project:cg_snapshots:detail"

the removal of the volumes section of the link was correct for that
change, but changing "cg_snapshot_detail" to "detail" broke the
details link

Change-Id: I7ad8673bad353a234596df16c8e64eec93733934
Closes-Bug: #1813990
'}]
commit_message:
Consistency Group Snapshots detail url is wrong

The link in the consistency group table for "detail" is a mismatch
for the corresponding value in the urls.py file, causing cg snapshots
clicks to not load details for the user.

This bug was introduced in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/429506
where the link in tables.py was changed from:
"horizon:project:volumes:cg_snapshots:cg_snapshot_detail"
to
"horizon:project:cg_snapshots:detail"

the removal of the volumes section of the link was correct for that
change, but changing "cg_snapshot_detail" to "detail" broke the
details link

Change-Id: I7ad8673bad353a234596df16c8e64eec93733934
Closes-Bug: #1813990

commit_message:
Add PacemakerNetwork definition

This gives us the 'pacemaker_node_ips' hiera key on all nodes, which
will be needed because pcs 0.10 needs to specify the ip addresses of the
cluster when setting up a pcmk2.0 cluster based on knet-corosync.

Change-Id: I2e92bb2424f9d674ba888a8c287a26b69f7d9dff

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-30 03:37:04.000000000', 'message': "Add stop_grace_period for heat_engine container

Heat engine requires longer shutdown time for cleanup. The default
10s is not enough. Let's increase it to something reasonable.

Change-Id: Ie80112d75a74b1a9d1d497edcfcda8dba3de5345
Closes-Bug: #1813771
"}]
commit_message:
Add stop_grace_period for heat_engine container

Heat engine requires longer shutdown time for cleanup. The default
10s is not enough. Let's increase it to something reasonable.

Change-Id: Ie80112d75a74b1a9d1d497edcfcda8dba3de5345
Closes-Bug: #1813771

commit_message:
Run tempest using os_tempest role in standalone job

In order to replace validate-tempest role, It is
the standalone job with os_tempest role to run
tempest in Tripleo CI.

Marking current os_tempest job as non-voting

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/554

Change-Id: Iac7b09dc39a60ded493bdb36942311b861352b16

commit_message:
[CEPH] Fixes for the OSD defrag cronjob

Fix a naming issue with the cronjob's binary, and schedule the cron
job to run every 15 minutes for the gates. Additonally check to
to ensure we are only running on block devices. Also update the
script to work with ceph-volume created devices.

Change-Id: I8aedab0ac41c191ef39a08034fff3278027d7520

commit_message:
Fix Safenet HSM regression in PKCS#11

This patch adds a new option `always_set_cka_sensitive`
to fix a regression that broke Safenet HSM compatibility.

Change-Id: I158c4c5be75fca73b7e33eec912d3347622e3fa6
Story: 2004734
Task: 28787
(cherry picked from commit fdfeb7362b620e6f28e0374d46b2445149304918)

commit_message:
remove python-beaker from openstack-base rpm list

this package is a WSGI helper for caching, not in openstack
requirements, and only referenced in refstack and airship.

If it's used by any packages that I missed it should be implicitly
installed where used/needed instead of in openstack-base and not used

Change-Id: Iafd6678846e7c495cc96a6d3a7681d70a4bf8171

and not the nodenames + addr=... strings.

commit_message:
Initial pcs 0.10 support

pcs 0.10 has changed a few things around cluster authentication
so we need to parametrize things depending on the pcs version on the
system.

We also make sure that if you use the cluster_members_addr parameter
it stays compatible with pcs 0.9 by only returning the node names
and not the nodenames + addr=... strings.

Tested this on a standalone env with pcs 0.10 (rhel8os + f28 containers
no pre-installed pcs rpm) and on an OSP14 using pcs 0.9

Change-Id: I8693cc0fdd51be155273e0dba8bc14b3db79ba8d

[{'created': '2019-01-21 13:16:49.000000000', 'message': '[Configuration] Clean up .gitignore references to personal tools

Developers run all sorts of different tools within Git repositories,
any of which can leave their own special trashfiles all over the
place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to
recommend developers simply configure a global core.excludesfile to
filter the irrelevant files which tend to get created by their
personal choice of tools.

To this end, remove the long-standing sections for "Mr Developer"
and "Editors" since their mere existence here sends the signal that

We can, and should of course, continue to list files created by the
tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks called from tox,
documentation and packaging builds, et cetera).

commit_message:
[Configuration] Clean up .gitignore references to personal tools

Developers run all sorts of different tools within Git repositories,
any of which can leave their own special trashfiles all over the
place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to
recommend developers simply configure a global core.excludesfile to
filter the irrelevant files which tend to get created by their
personal choice of tools.

To this end, remove the long-standing sections for "Mr Developer"
and "Editors" since their mere existence here sends the signal that
we welcome (and have time to review) additions for any old tool
someone ever might happen to try. Also add a comment block
explaining this, for clarity.

We can, and should of course, continue to list files created by the
tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks called from tox,
documentation and packaging builds, et cetera).

Change-Id: Idc07fe4866eed931712f03c67ff154fc12f8befc

commit_message:
remove test dependencies from openstack-base

these containers should not need unittest support packages
in general, tempest may need one of these but that should be
installed as needed not for all container images.

- testtools - introduced in
- unittest2 - introduced in Ia3a9756c58f0ead3b20e435f1d1546408f4a8b36
- zake - introduced in Ie05ba975bc2f88cd9ee896aafc60171d6ca8d10b
- fixtures - introduced in Ia3a9756c58f0ead3b20e435f1d1546408f4a8b36

Change-Id: Ic2325afc6ce3ee9f8a8c03ad19050809255df2f5

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-30 17:50:09.000000000', 'message': 'Allow running more commands dockerless

The `--save-dependency`, `--list-images`, and `--list-dependencies`
options to the kolla-build commands do not actually require docker
daemon running. This commit stop kolla-build from complaining when it is
called with one of the above options without docker daemon started.

Change-Id: I966587236aca363316db8abbfc04763655b4b68f
'}]
commit_message:
Allow running more commands dockerless

The `--save-dependency`, `--list-images`, and `--list-dependencies`
options to the kolla-build commands do not actually require docker
daemon running. This commit stop kolla-build from complaining when it is
called with one of the above options without docker daemon started.

Change-Id: I966587236aca363316db8abbfc04763655b4b68f

commit_message:
[stable-only] ignore pycodestyle E117 check

pycodestyle 2.5.0 has introduced new E117 check.

Ignore this check to unbreak the gate in stable branches,
until I594e2d1238f6ffa3c1039624e3b3ed6569485837 is backported.

Change-Id: I9f5e015868270ec3ca15b63e999b36e21cf26bb8

commit_message:
Add output for ip6tables and related ipv6 things

Until now, we don't have any output for iptables rules applied to v6.
It can be interesting to get them, especially since standard behavior
is to try first ipv6 if a name as associated v6. Even for localhost.

This patch also reformat a bit the output in the files, adding some
headers for a better reading.

Change-Id: I62e5c03fa38f5c4c266fbf27bd4f1ec0f3bf0633

Qemu certs are note used by libvirt and therefore does not need a restart.
In case certs gets renewed, right now qemu processes (instances) need to be

commit_message:
Remove postsave_cmd and restart libvirt on cert files change

Qemu certs are note used by libvirt and therefore does not need a restart.
In case certs gets renewed, right now qemu processes (instances) need to be
restarted. This removes the postsave_cmd and also restart libvirt on cert
file change.

Change-Id: I1a72265b369271f7bdfd3aaa143aad14a861a90a

commit_message:
Scan templated python files with bandit

This change adds a zuul check job to export any templated python
contained in the helm charts and scan it with bandit for any
potential security flaws.

This also adds two nosec comments on the instances of subprocess
used as they currently do not appear to be malicious, as well
as changing the endpoint_update python code to prevent sql
injection, which satisfies bandit code B608.

Change-Id: I2212d26514c3510353d16a4592893dd2e85cb369

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-29 13:32:23.000000000', 'message': 'Skip checking of target_dev for vhostuser

Nova skips detaching of ovs dpdk interfaces
thinking that it's already detached because
get_interface_by_cfg() return no inteface.
This is due to _set_config_VIFVHostUser()
not setting target_dev in configuration while
LibvirtConfigGuestInterface sets target_dev
if tag "target" is found in the interface.

As target_dev is not a valid value for
vhostuser interface, it will not be checked
for vhostuser type.

Change-Id: Iaf185b98c236df47e44cda0732ee0aed1fd6323d
Closes-Bug: #1807340
(cherry picked from commit a19c38a6ab13cdf2509a1f9f9d39c7f0a70ba121)
'}]
commit_message:
Skip checking of target_dev for vhostuser

Nova skips detaching of ovs dpdk interfaces
thinking that it's already detached because
get_interface_by_cfg() return no inteface.
This is due to _set_config_VIFVHostUser()
not setting target_dev in configuration while
LibvirtConfigGuestInterface sets target_dev
if tag "target" is found in the interface.

As target_dev is not a valid value for
vhostuser interface, it will not be checked
for vhostuser type.

Change-Id: Iaf185b98c236df47e44cda0732ee0aed1fd6323d
Closes-Bug: #1807340
(cherry picked from commit a19c38a6ab13cdf2509a1f9f9d39c7f0a70ba121)

commit_message:
Restore nova-consoleauth to install docs

The installation of the nova-consoleauth service was erroneously
removed from the docs prematurely. The nova-consoleauth service
is still being used in Rocky, with the removal being possible in
Stein.

This should have been fixed as part of change
Ibbdc7c50c312da2acc59dfe64de95a519f87f123 but was missed.

This is also related to the release note update in Rocky
under change Ie637b4871df8b870193b5bc07eece15c03860c06.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1793255
Related-Bug: #1798188

Change-Id: Ied268da9e70bd2807c2dfe7a479181fbec52979d
(cherry picked from commit 983e6ea5518dee956d8054cd67dddbe98eab9f78)

commit_message:
Fix port dns_name reset

When external DNS service is enabled, use user's context to request
dns_name reset instead of using admin context. The dns record need
be found in user's zone and recordset.

Change-Id: I35335b501f8961b9ac8e5f92e0686e402b78617b
Closes-Bug: #1812110
(cherry picked from commit 1b797f6f7e99fdef380340d6fe29e4004be48781)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-30 14:25:47.000000000', 'message': "Don't call begin_detaching when detaching volume from shelved vm

When shelve an instance, if the instance has volume attached,
with new attach/detach flow, we will delete the old attachment
and create a new attachment, the volume status will be ``reserved``.

If the user tries to detach these volumes, it fails due to that
Cinder does not allow a begin_detaching() call on a `reserved` volume.

Actually for shelved instances, we can just skip this step and
directly detach it.

Change-Id: Ib1799feebbd8f4b0f389168939df7e5e90c8add1
closes-bug: #1808089
(cherry picked from commit 41b982c9feec3105247bc72d23d1470bcabc3a0f)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't call begin_detaching when detaching volume from shelved vm

When shelve an instance, if the instance has volume attached,
with new attach/detach flow, we will delete the old attachment
and create a new attachment, the volume status will be ``reserved``.

If the user tries to detach these volumes, it fails due to that
Cinder does not allow a begin_detaching() call on a `reserved` volume.

Actually for shelved instances, we can just skip this step and
directly detach it.

Change-Id: Ib1799feebbd8f4b0f389168939df7e5e90c8add1
closes-bug: #1808089
(cherry picked from commit 41b982c9feec3105247bc72d23d1470bcabc3a0f)

subject: Revert "Update kafka version to 2.1.0"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7102, 'name': 'Thomas Bechtold', 'email': 'thomas.bechtold@canonical.com', 'username': 'toabctl'}, {'_account_id': 13039, 'name': 'Martin André', 'email': 'm.andre@redhat.com', 'username': 'mandre'}, {'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'mark@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 17669, 'name': 'Doug Szumski', 'email': 'doug@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'DougSzumski'}, {'_account_id': 19316, 'name': 'Eduardo Gonzalez', 'email': 'dabarren@gmail.com', 'username': 'egonzalez90'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22629, 'name': 'Michal Nasiadka', 'email': 'mnasiadka@gmail.com', 'username': 'mnasiadka'}, {'_account_id': 23717, 'name': 'Surya Prakash Singh', 'email': 'singh.surya64mnnit@gmail.com', 'username': 'SuryaPrakash'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-01-29 14:06:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-01-29 14:18:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think we should revert this patch for the reasons in this PR: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/587274/

I am not against upgrading Kafka to a new major release longer term, but:

1. Monasca hasn't been well tested with Kafka 2.x yet
2. We haven't considered upgrades from Kafka 1.0.2 to 2.1.0 and it isn't obvious who will complete this work in the current cycle"}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-01-29 14:27:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I think we should revert this patch for the reasons in this PR:
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/587274/
 > 
 > I am not against upgrading Kafka to a new major release longer
 > term, but:
 > 
 > 1. Monasca hasn't been well tested with Kafka 2.x yet

Do you have a definition of "well tested" somewhere? What do you expect before we can upgrade?

 > 2. We haven't considered upgrades from Kafka 1.0.2 to 2.1.0 and it
 > isn't obvious who will complete this work in the current cycle

There is some guide here: https://kafka.apache.org/20/documentation/streams/upgrade-guide

So should this be automated *before* we can upgrade the kafka version? How was this handled for previous version updates?'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-29 14:29:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-01-29 14:40:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I think we should revert this patch for the reasons in this PR:
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/587274/
 
Which reasons? We are not in a feature freeze phase. or are we?'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-01-29 14:52:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

There hasn't been any significant testing of Monasca with Kafka 2.1.0 (as you pointed out here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/629876/). I think we should wait to upgrade this until the Monasca project officially supports the Kafka 2.x release. That will at least require some testing, eg. running a deployment for a few days under some load, and if possible some benchmarking.

In Kolla I think we should at least announce the major version upgrade so that people know about the upgrade procedure, and support the upgrade from Kolla Ansible for Monasca (if required - I haven't tried it yet)."}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2019-01-30 08:12:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Sorry Thomas, your patch was not ready to merge and we need to revert it. As I understand kafka v2 is not officially supported by monasca project, I'd prefer to hold off until they explicitly support it.

Also, according to https://kafka.apache.org/20/documentation/streams/upgrade-guide upgrade from v1 to v2 is not trivial. There should at least be a release note in kolla explaining how to upgrade. Even better if there is a corresponding change in kolla-ansible to handle the upgrade."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-30 08:55:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

recheck'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2019-01-31 10:10:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]

[{'created': '2019-01-25 15:53:38.000000000', 'message': 'Log the result of command in get_nic_name_by_ip

We need to know the result of the command run
in get_nic_name_by_ip to see what is getting parsed
since we are returning the empty string in some
cases which results in an error because
/var/run/udhcpc..pid does not exist in the guest.

Change-Id: Ie15ac360a7fd384583607d5bf1d8ce7a3d2c3576
Related-Bug: #1813198
'}]
commit_message:
Log the result of command in get_nic_name_by_ip

We need to know the result of the command run
in get_nic_name_by_ip to see what is getting parsed
since we are returning the empty string in some
cases which results in an error because
/var/run/udhcpc..pid does not exist in the guest.

Change-Id: Ie15ac360a7fd384583607d5bf1d8ce7a3d2c3576
Related-Bug: #1813198

One thing I noticed (and this has nothing to do with this patch) is that the help for glance-manage is pretty awful.  I think it has to do with the pattern we're using with the subcommand processor.  Maybe it would be a good topic for a bug-day fix."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-07-05 13:35:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-07-05 16:33:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

retry'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-05 17:58:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

This looks good.  The only thing I noticed in testing is that I got a foreign key constraint that blocked purging the images table, but that was mostly because of the nature of my test data.  What happened was that all my stuff had deleted_at within the same day, and I used --max_rows so I didn't purge all of it.  It just so happened that when I later tested the purge_images_table call, some image_properties and image_locations were hanging around that prevented the row in the images table from being purged.  I think the best way to deal with this is to mention it in the documentation, namely, that if you don't run the "regular" purge first, you're likely to get and IntegrityError when you purge the images table.  I don't think it's a problem because the intended use is that an operator will be regularly "regular" purging, and at some point may need to purge some really old stuff out of the images table.  Under that scenario, this error won't occur.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-05 19:11:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-05 21:13:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Mitigate OSSN-0075

Modified the current ``glance-manage db purge`` command to eliminate images
table from purging the records. Added new command
``glance-manage db purge_images_table`` to purge the records from images
table.

DocImpact
SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ie6641659b54543ed9f96c393d664e52a26bfaf6a
Implements: blueprint mitigate-ossn-0075

commit_message:
Revert "Switch to stestr"

Turns out the functional tests with python3.5 started to fail due to
this change.

We will need to investigate it better prior to going ahead with
switching to stestr, unfortunately.

This reverts commit b713ad36fb00fba93cb943e879674c61d6b71491.

Change-Id: I2da1c9fd3294dc4abba95ea31a8f92bdd8f50a8a

[{'created': '2018-08-21 15:04:48.000000000', 'message': 'Add extend in-use volumes support for RBD

Adds the required bits to enable extension of in-use RBD volumes.
This relies in a patch that retrieves a volume without device_path,
and a patch in os-brick that retrieves the size of the extended
volume

Implements: blueprint extend-in-use-rbd-volumes
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/589925

Change-Id: I6b6e87d8c68af8d51fa896e38a607e0e190de7ae
'}]
commit_message:
Add extend in-use volumes support for RBD

Adds the required bits to enable extension of in-use RBD volumes.
This relies in a patch that retrieves a volume without device_path,
and a patch in os-brick that retrieves the size of the extended
volume

Implements: blueprint extend-in-use-rbd-volumes
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/589925

Change-Id: I6b6e87d8c68af8d51fa896e38a607e0e190de7ae

subject: Manila stable/queens 6.1.0 release
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-01-25 16:10:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-01-25 18:32:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-28 19:46:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-01-29 01:50:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Deprecating config options during a release is questionable and frankly the bug that this ( I148e9079c7c1ab119f519f727d4ad97758473325) fixes should have been done in a way that was stable friendly.

However that ship has sailed so now the only way to fix the bug on older branches is with the backport.

At the very least we should make this a minor version bump to increase the chance that the release notes get read.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-01-29 02:12:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Deprecating config options during a release is questionable and frankly the bug that this (I148e9079c7c1ab119f519f727d4ad97758473325) fixes should have been done in a way that was stable friendly. However that ship has sailed so now the only way to fix the bug on older branches is with the backport.

Hi Tony, yes - we discussed this one quite a bit, frankly :( Although we are pushing a deprecation flag and warning, we're correcting a behavior we didn't catch in our tests that caused pain to deployers; we probably assumed that keystonev2 would continue to work in Queens, however, the lack of it makes manila unusable with nova, neutron and cinder because internally we were continuing to override with deprecated options that had default values. 

However, this bug fix was done in a stable-friendly manner, i.e, if deployers specified the deprecated options, things will still work, albeit a new deprecation warning will start showing up in the logs when deployers upgrade to this version."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-01-29 02:20:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> However, this bug fix was done in a stable-friendly manner, i.e, if
 > deployers specified the deprecated options, things will still work,
 > albeit a new deprecation warning will start showing up in the logs
 > when deployers upgrade to this version.

We'll have to agree to disagree.  I would have preferred that deprecated options were made to work as expected in a patch and the deprecations added in a later patch.  That way the first could be backported *without* introducing the deprecation warnings.

While adding a deprecation like this isn't expressly against the policy it's pretty strange for the options to be removed from the configuration reference and start logging during a released branch.

I'm not blocking this release but I am asking for the semver to be a minor bump."}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-01-29 02:26:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-01-29 02:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I agree that minor bumps make sense for this.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-30 20:20:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-30 20:35:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-01-31 12:17:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2019-01-10 09:52:55.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Make versioned notifications topics configurable

Some services (such as telemetry) actually consume the notifications.
If one deploys a service that listens on the same queue as telemetry,
there will be race-conditions with these services and one will not get
the notifications that are expected at points.

To address this, one sets a different topic and consumes from there.
This is not possible with versioned notifications at the moment. And, as
services move towards using them, the same need will arise.

This adds a configuration option to Ironic enabling the configuration
of topics for this notifier.

A similar change was introduced in nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/444947/

Change-Id: Ib75feac0979d0094cb137abb13b0fe0ff4576eee
Story: 2004735

commit_message:
Make versioned notifications topics configurable

Some services (such as telemetry) actually consume the notifications.
If one deploys a service that listens on the same queue as telemetry,
there will be race-conditions with these services and one will not get
the notifications that are expected at points.

To address this, one sets a different topic and consumes from there.
This is not possible with versioned notifications at the moment. And, as
services move towards using them, the same need will arise.

This adds a configuration option to Ironic enabling the configuration
of topics for this notifier.

A similar change was introduced in nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/444947/

Change-Id: Ib75feac0979d0094cb137abb13b0fe0ff4576eee
Story: 2004735
Task: 28788

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-30 15:09:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix whitespace in neutron.conf template

The Jinja2 templating code can introduce whitespace which ends up in
front of the `# General, applies...` comment. This leads to a parsing
error when Neutron is started and the Neutron installation playbook
fails. Note that this change leaves _more_ whitespace in the beginning
of neutron.conf, but preserves the newline in front of the comment.

Change-Id: Ib9a9e44f25dcabb92df6067852e91115d30fe740
(cherry picked from commit 81e499fbe2819f1d6b202b8d48ee0f79f87990e4)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix whitespace in neutron.conf template

The Jinja2 templating code can introduce whitespace which ends up in
front of the `# General, applies...` comment. This leads to a parsing
error when Neutron is started and the Neutron installation playbook
fails. Note that this change leaves _more_ whitespace in the beginning
of neutron.conf, but preserves the newline in front of the comment.

Change-Id: Ib9a9e44f25dcabb92df6067852e91115d30fe740
(cherry picked from commit 81e499fbe2819f1d6b202b8d48ee0f79f87990e4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-31 05:50:51.000000000', 'message': 'Correct regular expression of volume type extra spec key

The "-" in the regex group has to be the first or the last character,
otherwise it counts as a range.

This is a follow-up patch of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632204/

Change-Id: I08f80410540cb73f74837fe3ac83bd16f1ae7978
'}]
commit_message:
Correct regular expression of volume type extra spec key

The "-" in the regex group has to be the first or the last character,
otherwise it counts as a range.

This is a follow-up patch of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632204/

Change-Id: I08f80410540cb73f74837fe3ac83bd16f1ae7978

This reverts commit 96aded3c3429318e63acf9b21dc8ac8a186b0f00.

The reverted commit breaks "manage.py compress" in python 2.7 env.
python 2.7 support is more important than osprofiler support,

commit_message:
Revert "Fix osprofiler support in horizon"

This reverts commit 96aded3c3429318e63acf9b21dc8ac8a186b0f00.

The reverted commit breaks "manage.py compress" in python 2.7 env.
python 2.7 support is more important than osprofiler support,
so we revert this once and then tackle the original osprofiler issue.

Change-Id: Iff497a96fd62b447906a0c58fdcd6ce717d6fabe
Related-Bug: #1814028
Related-Bug: #1811261

commit_message:
TLS everywhere: Set post-save command for RabbitMQ

The default command wasn't working, here we set one that will actually work.

The script additionally copies the certificates in the right place
and instead of restarting RabbitMQ, it triggers a pem cache reload.

Related-Bug: #1811401
Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Depends-On: Id06633a1adaafe1fef1d3d7f6b2af3ef5ffc9d4a
Change-Id: I3e564f9a5abdbf11d0580c4ff801092f32bcc678

[{'created': '2019-01-25 09:20:58.000000000', 'message': "TLS everywhere: Set post-save command for httpd

The default command wasn't working, so here we set one that will
actually work.

httpd is a fairly simple instance, since the certs are mounted from the
directory (and not the individual certs). So there is no need to copy
anything to the container or do any post-processing. All we need to do
is tell httpd to load the new certs.

Related-Bug: #1811401
Depends-On: I642f48aa0e66ca57de2ecee921c798747ba41e1a

commit_message:
TLS everywhere: Set post-save command for httpd

The default command wasn't working, so here we set one that will
actually work.

httpd is a fairly simple instance, since the certs are mounted from the
directory (and not the individual certs). So there is no need to copy
anything to the container or do any post-processing. All we need to do
is tell httpd to load the new certs.
